analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la lhag par dmigs par bya ba'i phyir dang / zag pa med pa'i chos bye brag gis bsgom par bya ba'i phyir dang / shin tu rnam par phye ba rnam par 'byed pa shes rab chen po snang ba la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir dang /

original: shin tu brtags pa'i ye shes kyi sgo la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dang / gnas gzhan ci rigs su rab tu brjod pa la bag 'chums pa med pa'i spobs pas snang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / so so yang dag par rig pa chen po'i sa shin tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: shin tu brtags pa'i ye shes kyi sgo la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dang / gnas gzhan ci rigs su rab tu brjod pa la bag 'chums pa med pa'i spobs pas snang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / so so yang dag par rig pa chen po'i sa shin tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to enter the door of the wisdom of thorough investigation, in order to illuminate with the eloquence of non-timidity in proclaiming the Dharma in various places, in order to thoroughly realize the stage of great analytical knowledges,üîΩin order to make the inexpressible through the thought of enlightenment, in order to ripen the entire realm of sentient beings, in order to attain the ascertainment that penetrates everywhere, he blessed them.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad lhag par dmigs par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: observing all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: de nyid kyi ched du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs na zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs pa bye brag gis bsgom pa'i rnam pa khong du chud par byed pas sbyor ba rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi ched du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs na zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs pa bye brag gis bsgom pa'i rnam pa khong du chud par byed pas sbyor ba rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir /

analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos bye brag gi bsgom par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o // mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs na chos bdag med pa shes pa la mkhas par byed pas rtogs par byed pa rtsom zhing thob pa ni gang gi phyir shin tu rnam par phye ba rnam par 'byed pa shes rab chen po snang ba la mkhas par bya ba'i

original: phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: becoming skilled in the illumination of great wisdom that thoroughly discerns and analyzes.

original: de la shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba ni de'i pha rol na yang rnam par dbye bar bya ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de la shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba ni de'i pha rol na yang rnam par dbye bar bya ba med pa ste /
translated: The term very well differentiated means that there is nothing beyond it to be differentiated.

original: de ni chos bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni chos bdag med pa'o //
translated: This is the selflessness of dharmas.

original: de rnam par 'byed pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam par 'byed pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: The differentiation of that is knowledge.

original: de ni shes rab chen po yang yin te /
analyzed: de ni shes rab chen po yang yin te /
translated: It is also great wisdom

original: theg pa dman pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it transcends the lower vehicles.

original: de ni snang ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de ni snang ba yang yin te /
translated: It is also illumination

original: de mi shes pa'i mun pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de mi shes pa'i mun pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the antidote to the darkness of ignorance of that.

original: de'i tshe na de la mkhas pa yin no //üîΩ'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa shes pas chos kyi rnam grangs kyi don rtogs par @107a * //üîΩbyed pas bsgom pa'i lam rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe na de la mkhas pa yin no // 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa shes pas chos kyi rnam grangs kyi don rtogs par @107a * // byed pas bsgom pa'i lam rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: At that time, one is skilled in that.

original: shin tu brtags pa'i ye shes kyi sgo la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu brtags pa'i ye shes kyi sgo la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: After supramundane wisdom, one comprehends the meaning of the Dharma categories through knowledge. The beginning and attainment of the path of cultivation is stated as in order to enter the door of very well examined wisdom.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la byang chub mi 'thob pa'i nyes pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la byang chub mi 'thob pa'i nyes pa lnga yod de /
translated: There are five faults in the bodhisattva who is in that stage, which prevent the attainment of enlightenment.

original: phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod par mi nus pa ni gang gis na phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis de yang rang gi phyogs las bsgyur du rung ba dang / pha rol yang gzhan du bkrir rung ba'o //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod par mi nus pa ni gang gis na phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis de yang rang gi phyogs las bsgyur du rung ba dang / pha rol yang gzhan du bkrir rung ba'o //
translated: He is unable to overcome adversaries, since he can be turned away from his own position by adversaries and can be led to another position by them.

original: dris pa'i lan 'debs mi nus pa ni gang gis dris na de rmongs pa dang / pha rol yang 'jug par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: dris pa'i lan 'debs mi nus pa ni gang gis dris na de rmongs pa dang / pha rol yang 'jug par mi byed pa'o //
translated: He is unable to answer questions, since he is confused when questioned and does not engage others.

original: theg pa dman pa 'dod pa ni gang gis na bdag nyid kyang byang chub chen po mi 'thob la /
analyzed: theg pa dman pa 'dod pa ni gang gis na bdag nyid kyang byang chub chen po mi 'thob la /
translated: He desires the Hinayana, since he does not attain great enlightenment himself

original: gzhan gyi don yang yal bar 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yang yal bar 'dor ba'o //
translated: and abandons the welfare of others.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la le lo byed pa ni gang gis na gzhan gyi don gtong zhing bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan gyi don byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang mi thob pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la le lo byed pa ni gang gis na gzhan gyi don gtong zhing bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan gyi don byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang mi thob pa'o //
translated: He is lazy in bringing beings to maturity, since he abandons the welfare of others and does not obtain the roots of virtue that come from the cause of working for the welfare of others.

original: thabs mi shes pa ni gang gis na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: thabs mi shes pa ni gang gis na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed mi nus pa'o //
translated: Lack of knowledge of means is the inability to ripen beings and to complete the accumulations for enlightenment.

original: de dag gi gnyen por rtsom zhing 'thob pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por rtsom zhing 'thob pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The five kinds of success should be understood as the antidotes to these.

original: rang gi phyogs kyi khyad par ci rigs par yongs su bstan pa la bag tshab med par lan 'debs pa'i spobs pa mun pa med pas phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod nus pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir gnas gzhan rigs su rab tu brjod pa
analyzed: rang gi phyogs kyi khyad par ci rigs par yongs su bstan pa la bag tshab med par lan 'debs pa'i spobs pa mun pa med pas phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod nus pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir gnas gzhan rigs su rab tu brjod pa
translated: The success of undertaking and obtaining is the ability to defeat opponents by means of unobscured eloquence in answering any question about the specific points of one's own position, because one is able to illuminate the other abodes of beings.

original: la bag 'chums pa med pa'i spobs pas snang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: la bag 'chums pa med pa'i spobs pas snang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement, ‚ÄúIn order to illuminate with the eloquence of unhesitating eloquence.‚Äù

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i sa shes pas mngon sum du byed pa dris pas lan 'debs nus pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir so so yang dag par rig pa chen po'i sa shin tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩbyang chub tu smon lam btab pa'i phyir byang chub dran pa chud mi gson pas theg pa dman par 'gro ba'i gnyen po rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i sa shes pas mngon sum du byed pa dris pas lan 'debs nus pa rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir so so yang dag par rig pa chen po'i sa shin tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o // byang chub tu smon lam btab pa'i phyir byang chub dran pa chud mi gson pas theg pa dman par 'gro ba'i gnyen po rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The power to compose and attain the answer to the question of the stage of analytical knowledge is stated as follows: ‚ÄúIn order to thoroughly understand the stage of great analytical knowledge.‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi dran pa brjed pa med par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩsems can thams cad kyi don bya ba la yongs su mi skyo bas sems can gyi don bya ba la le lo byed pa'i gnyen po rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi dran pa brjed pa med par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o // sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba la yongs su mi skyo bas sems can gyi don bya ba la le lo byed pa'i gnyen po rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The power to compose and attain the antidote to going to the lower vehicle by not forgetting the mindfulness of enlightenment, because of having made a vow for enlightenment, is stated as follows: ‚ÄúIn order not to forget the mindfulness of the thought of enlightenment.‚Äù

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The power to compose and attain the antidote to laziness in working for the welfare of sentient beings by not being discouraged from working for the welfare of all sentient beings is stated as follows: ‚ÄúIn order to bring to maturity the entire realm of sentient beings.‚Äù

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga dag tu zhugs @107b pa'i rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa rtogs par byed pas thabs mi shes pa'i gnyen por rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir thams cad du zhugs pa'i rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga dag tu zhugs @107b pa'i rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa rtogs par byed pas thabs mi shes pa'i gnyen por rtsom zhing 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir thams cad du zhugs pa'i rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs
translated: The remedy for the antidote that does not know the means is the composition and attainment of the means, which is stated as ‚Äúin order to attain the ascertainment that engages in all five sciences.‚Äù

original: pa'o // 'di ni gang gi phyir byin gyis brlab pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // 'di ni gang gi phyir byin gyis brlab pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the blessing.

original: ji ltar byin gyis brlab ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar byin gyis brlab ce na /
translated: How is there a blessing?

original: gsung dang / thugs dang / skus so //
analyzed: gsung dang / thugs dang / skus so //
translated: By speech, mind, and body.

original: gsung gi byin gyis brlabs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gsung gi byin gyis brlabs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is there a blessing of speech?

original: yang rigs kyi bu khyod chos rnams kyi sgo rab tu dbye ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di las sangs rgyas kyi mthus de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes snang ba'i byin gyi rlabs kyi dang / rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: yang rigs kyi bu khyod chos rnams kyi sgo rab tu dbye ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di las sangs rgyas kyi mthus de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes snang ba'i byin gyi rlabs kyi dang / rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir dang /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, son of noble family, through the power of the Buddha, you will become skilled in opening the door of the Dharma to this Dharma discourse, through the blessing of the TathƒÅgata J√±ƒÅnƒÅloka and because of the purity of your own roots of virtue.

original: chos kyi dbyings sbyangs pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi khams la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / chos kyi sku ye shes kyi sku'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba yang dag par nod pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i lus 'byung ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings sbyangs pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi khams la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / chos kyi sku ye shes kyi sku'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba yang dag par nod pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i lus 'byung ba'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to purify the dharmadhatu, in order to benefit the realm of sentient beings, in order to transform the dharmakaya into the jnanakaya, in order to receive the consecration of all buddhas, in order to manifest a body that is superior to all worlds,

original: 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi 'gro ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir spobs par gyis shig ces bya ba bcu pa 'dis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi 'gro ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir spobs par gyis shig ces bya ba bcu pa 'dis so //
translated: in order to transcend all worldly destinies, in order to purify the destiny of supramundane dharmas, and in order to perfect omniscient wisdom.

original: de la spobs pa ni ji ltar 'dris pa'i chos kyi don ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: de la spobs pa ni ji ltar 'dris pa'i chos kyi don ma brjed pa'o //
translated: Here, eloquence is the non-forgetting of the meaning of the dharmas as one is familiar with them.

original: chos rnams kyi sgo dag ni chos kyi rnam grangs rnams so //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi sgo dag ni chos kyi rnam grangs rnams so //
translated: The doors of the dharmas are the various categories of the Dharma.

original: de dag gi rnam pa tha dad pa ni rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa tha dad pa ni rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: Their different aspects are their divisions.

original: de la chos kyi rnam grangs 'dis mkhas par 'gyur bas de la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos kyi rnam grangs 'dis mkhas par 'gyur bas de la mkhas pa'o //
translated: One who is skilled in this Dharma discourse is skilled in it.

original: spobs pa'i rtsa ba de la brten nas /
analyzed: spobs pa'i rtsa ba de la brten nas /
translated: Eloquence is based on that root.

original: spobs pa gzhan rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spobs pa gzhan rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two other types of eloquence:

original: gzhan gyi mthus spobs pa dang / rang gi mthus spobs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi mthus spobs pa dang / rang gi mthus spobs pa'o //
translated: eloquence through the power of others and eloquence through one's own power.

original: de la gzhan gyi mthus spobs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mthus te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi mthus spobs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mthus te /
translated: Among them, eloquence through the power of others is through the power of the Buddha.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi mthus she na /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi mthus she na /
translated: How is it through the power of the Buddha?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi mun pa med par byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi mun pa med par byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
translated: It is the blessing of the Tathagata's wisdom that removes darkness.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes snang ba'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes snang ba'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is said, through the blessing of the light of the Tathagata's wisdom.

original: de la rang gi mthus spobs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la rang gi mthus spobs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Among them, eloquence through one's own power is of four types:

original: 'dus byas kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos yongs su dag pas spobs pa ni gang gi phyir rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir @108a * //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos yongs su dag pas spobs pa ni gang gi phyir rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir @108a * // zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Eloquence purified by the wholesome roots of conditioned phenomena is that by which one's wholesome roots are purified.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos yongs su dag pas spobs pa ni gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos yongs su dag pas spobs pa ni gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Eloquence purified by unconditioned phenomena is that by which the realm of phenomena is purified.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i yongs su dag pas spobs pa ni gang gi phyir sems can gyi khams phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i yongs su dag pas spobs pa ni gang gi phyir sems can gyi khams phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Eloquence purified by the purification of ripening sentient beings is that by which the realm of sentient beings is benefited.

original: gnas yongs su dag pas spobs pa ni gnas yongs su dag pa de yang mthar phyin pa rnam pa gsum gyis rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: gnas yongs su dag pas spobs pa ni gnas yongs su dag pa de yang mthar phyin pa rnam pa gsum gyis rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: Eloquence purified by the purification of abodes is that by which the purification of abodes is distinguished by three perfections.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthar phyin pa phan yon gnyis dang ldan pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / thun mong pa'i mthar phyin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthar phyin pa phan yon gnyis dang ldan pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / thun mong pa'i mthar phyin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's perfection is endowed with two benefits, the perfection shared with the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, and the Tathagata's perfection.

original: de la mthar phyin pa dang po ni chos kyi sku sems dang yid dang / rnam par shes pa spangs pa ye shes 'ba' zhig gis gnas te gang gi phyir chos kyi sku ye shes kyi sku'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mthar phyin pa dang po ni chos kyi sku sems dang yid dang / rnam par shes pa spangs pa ye shes 'ba' zhig gis gnas te gang gi phyir chos kyi sku ye shes kyi sku'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: The first perfection is the dharmakaya, which is the abode of only intuition, since it is free from mind, mentality, and consciousness. It is said that the dharmakaya is the intuition body.

original: de'i phan yon rnam pa gnyis ni tshe 'di la sangs rgyas kyis dbang bskur ba yang dag par nod pa dang / tshe phyi ma la dbang phyug chen po'i gnas su skye ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phan yon rnam pa gnyis ni tshe 'di la sangs rgyas kyis dbang bskur ba yang dag par nod pa dang / tshe phyi ma la dbang phyug chen po'i gnas su skye ba ste /
translated: The two benefits are that in this life one receives the consecration of the buddhas, and in the next life one is born in the abode of Mahesvara.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba yang dag par nod pa'i chos kyi 'gro ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i lus 'byung ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba yang dag par nod pa'i chos kyi 'gro ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i lus 'byung ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he has received the consecration of all the Buddhas, and because he has the pure destiny of the Dharma, and because his body is superior to all the worlds.

original: mthar phyin pa gnyis pa ni 'gro ba lnga las yang dag par 'das pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i las lam yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: mthar phyin pa gnyis pa ni 'gro ba lnga las yang dag par 'das pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i las lam yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The second perfection is the complete transcendence of the five destinies and the complete purification of the path to nirvana.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi 'gro ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi 'gro ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because he has completely transcended all worldly destinies and because he has the pure destiny of the supramundane Dharma.

original: mthar phyin pa gsum pa ni shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa ste gang gi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa gsum pa ni shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa ste gang gi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The third perfection is the complete perfection of the unobstructed intuition with respect to all objects of knowledge. Because he has the complete perfection of omniscient intuition.

original: gong nas gong du rang gi mthus spobs pa khyad par du 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gong nas gong du rang gi mthus spobs pa khyad par du 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that through one's own power, one's eloquence will become increasingly special.

original: gsung gis byin gyis brlabs pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: gsung gis byin gyis brlabs pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the blessing of the Buddha's speech.

original: thugs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ji lta bu zhen /
analyzed: thugs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ji lta bu zhen /
translated: What is the blessing of the Buddha's mind?

original: de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la zil gyis mi non pa'i lus nyid nye bar sgrub par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la zil gyis mi non pa'i lus nyid nye bar sgrub par mdzad de /
translated: Then those Buddha Bhagavans established the Bodhisattva Vajra garbha in the very state of being unvanquished.

original: thob @108b pa med pa'i spobs pas ston pa dang / shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa'i ye shes kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba la 'jug pa dang / brjed pa med pa'i byin rlabs dang / shin tu rnam par nges pa'i blo gros la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: thob @108b pa med pa'i spobs pas ston pa dang / shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa'i ye shes kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba la 'jug pa dang / brjed pa med pa'i byin rlabs dang / shin tu rnam par nges pa'i blo gros la mkhas pa dang /
translated: They gave him the teaching of unobstructed eloquence, the entry into the well-purified wisdom, the blessing of non-forgetfulness, and the skill in the discernment of the well-determined intellect.

original: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i blo mi 'dor ba nyid dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi stobs brdzi ba med pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa zhum pa med pa nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis so so yang dag par rig par rnam par dbye bas chos kyi tshul la rtog pa dang /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i blo mi 'dor ba nyid dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi stobs brdzi ba med pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa zhum pa med pa nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis so so yang dag par rig par rnam par dbye bas chos kyi tshul la rtog pa dang /
translated: the non-abandonment of the mind that has gone after all, the non-subjugation of the power of perfect complete Buddhahood, the non-timidity of the powers and fearlessnesses of the Tathagata, the investigation of the way of the Dharma by the analytical knowledges with the wisdom of omniscience,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi rgyan shin tu rnam par phye ba thams cad mngon par sgrub par mdzad do zhes bya ba bcu pa 'dis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi rgyan shin tu rnam par phye ba thams cad mngon par sgrub par mdzad do zhes bya ba bcu pa 'dis so //
translated: and the accomplishment of all the adornments of the body, speech, and mind of the Tathagata.

original: zil gyis mi non pa'i lus de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zil gyis mi non pa'i lus de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That unassailable body is of two kinds:

original: bla na med pa'i dpal gyis gzi brjid dang ldan zhing rang gi 'khor la rgyal po lta bu dang / spobs pa zil gyis mi non pa'i lus te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i dpal gyis gzi brjid dang ldan zhing rang gi 'khor la rgyal po lta bu dang / spobs pa zil gyis mi non pa'i lus te /
translated: endowed with splendor by way of unsurpassed glory, like a king in his own retinue, and the body of unassailable eloquence.

original: snga ma ni gzugs kyi sku'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: snga ma ni gzugs kyi sku'i bye brag gis so //
translated: The former is by way of the particularities of the rupakaya.

original: phyi ma ni ming gi tshogs kyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: phyi ma ni ming gi tshogs kyi bye brag gis so //
translated: The latter is due to the variety of the groups of names.

original: de yang rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: And that is ninefold:

original: rgyun chags su thogs pa med pa ston pas thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rgyun chags su thogs pa med pa ston pas thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The unimpeded eloquence of the teacher is due to the uninterrupted flow of teaching.

original: thogs pa med pa'i spobs pas ston pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i spobs pas ston pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that the teacher has unimpeded eloquence because of that.üîΩThe appropriate eloquence is due to the thorough purification of the knowledge of the four analytical knowledges.

original: rig pa rnam pa bzhi shes pa shin tu rnam par byang bar byas pas rig pa gang gis gang rigs sam mi rigs pa de khong du chud pa'i phyir rigs pa'i spobs pa ni /
analyzed: rig pa rnam pa bzhi shes pa shin tu rnam par byang bar byas pas rig pa gang gis gang rigs sam mi rigs pa de khong du chud pa'i phyir rigs pa'i spobs pa ni /
translated: By that knowledge, one understands what is appropriate and what is inappropriate.üîΩIt is said:üîΩThe four kinds of logical possibilityüîΩare intended as the four kinds of logical possibility.üîΩThe four kinds of logical possibility areüîΩthe possibility of dependence,üîΩthe possibility of the nature of reality,

original: ltos pa dang ni chos nyid dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang yang //üîΩ'thad pas sgrub pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: ltos pa dang ni chos nyid dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang yang // 'thad pas sgrub pa gang yin pa //
translated: and the possibility of effect and cause.

original: rigs pa rnam pa bzhir dgongs so//
analyzed: rigs pa rnam pa bzhir dgongs so//
translated: The four kinds of logical possibility areüîΩthe possibility of dependence,üîΩthe possibility of the nature of reality,üîΩand the possibility of effect and cause.

original: zhes bya bar rigs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bar rigs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four kinds of logical possibility are

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩshin tu rnam par sbyangs pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par phye ba la 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir /üîΩshin tu rnam par sbyangs pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par phye ba la 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the possibility of dependence,üîΩthe possibility of the nature of reality,üîΩand the possibility of effect and cause.

original: go rims la mi ltos par gtam gyis bar du gcod kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du de dang de nas tshig 'bru dang / don rjes su dran pas grol ba'i spobs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: go rims la mi ltos par gtam gyis bar du gcod kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du de dang de nas tshig 'bru dang / don rjes su dran pas grol ba'i spobs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Even if interrupted by conversation, without regard to order, he is liberated by the eloquence of remembering the words and their meanings, just as he wishes.

original: brjed pa med pa'i byin gyi rlabs zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: brjed pa med pa'i byin gyi rlabs zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is called the ‚Äúblessing of nonforgetfulness.‚Äù

original: brjed pa med pa'i byin gyi rlabs de ni gang gis de la byin gyis rlobs pa'o //
analyzed: brjed pa med pa'i byin gyi rlabs de ni gang gis de la byin gyis rlobs pa'o //
translated: This blessing of nonforgetfulness is what blesses him.

original: gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du rnam grangs dang dpe sna tshogs kyi the tshom gcod pas go bar byed pa'i spobs pa ni gang gi phyir /üîΩshin tu rnam par nges pa'i blo @109a * //
analyzed: gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du rnam grangs dang dpe sna tshogs kyi the tshom gcod pas go bar byed pa'i spobs pa ni gang gi phyir / shin tu rnam par nges pa'i blo @109a * //
translated: He has the eloquence of understanding, which cuts through the doubts of disciples through various enumerations and examples, just as they are.

original: gros la mkhas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gros la mkhas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúthe skill of the mind of complete ascertainment.‚Äù

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par shes pa rgyun mi 'chad par mngon du byed pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i spobs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par shes pa rgyun mi 'chad par mngon du byed pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i spobs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: He has the eloquence of nonaddiction, which manifests the uninterrupted stream of consciousness through the three general characteristics.

original: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i blo mi 'dor ba zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩsangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i stobs bcu po thogs pa med pas gdul bya'i kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag par 'joms pas nges par 'byin pa'i gdams ngag gi spobs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i blo mi 'dor ba zhes gsungs pa'o // sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i stobs bcu po thogs pa med pas gdul bya'i kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag par 'joms pas nges par 'byin pa'i gdams ngag gi spobs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe mind that has gone after all things is not lost‚Äù is made because of the power of the Buddha‚Äôs knowledge of the absorptions, liberations, etc.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi stobs brdzi ba med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //üîΩsangs rgyas la nges pa'i mi 'jigs pa zhum pa med pas phas kyis rgol bas mi 'jigs pa'i spobs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi stobs brdzi ba med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o // sangs rgyas la nges pa'i mi 'jigs pa zhum pa med pas phas kyis rgol bas mi 'jigs pa'i spobs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The power of eloquence in the instructions for definite release is due to the Buddha‚Äôs ten powers, which are unimpeded and which completely destroy the afflictions of those to be trained. The statement ‚Äúthe power of the perfect Buddha is invincible‚Äù is made because of this.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa zhum pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa zhum pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The power of eloquence in fearlessness is due to the Buddha‚Äôs four forms of fearlessness, which are not timid. The statement ‚Äúthe power and fearlessness of the Tathagata are not timid‚Äù is made because of this.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes su gtogs pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i rab tu dbye bas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes su gtogs pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i rab tu dbye bas /
translated: The power of eloquence in the analytical knowledges is due to the Buddha‚Äôs four analytical knowledges.

original: mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi tshul drug la rtog pas mi zad pa'i spobs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi tshul drug la rtog pas mi zad pa'i spobs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The inexhaustible eloquence of the Dharma, such as the scriptures, is due to the fact that,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi so so yang dag par rig pa'i rnam par dbye bas chos kyi tshul la rtog pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩsku la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul sangs rgyas dang 'brel pa gdul bya tha dad pas tha dad pa thams cad mngon du mdzad pa la mnga' pas cho 'phrul dang bcas pa'i spobs pas zil gyis mi non pa'i lus nyid ni /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi so so yang dag par rig pa'i rnam par dbye bas chos kyi tshul la rtog pa zhes gsungs pa'o // sku la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul sangs rgyas dang 'brel pa gdul bya tha dad pas tha dad pa thams cad mngon du mdzad pa la mnga' pas cho 'phrul dang bcas pa'i spobs pas zil gyis mi non pa'i lus nyid ni /
translated: by means of the analytical knowledges of the gnosis of omniscience, one has the power to understand the Dharma method.üîΩThe inexhaustible eloquence of miracles is due to the fact that,üîΩby means of the miracles of body and so on, one has the power to manifest all the different miracles for the different disciples connected with the Buddha.üîΩThe inexhaustible eloquence of the body is due to the fact that,

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rgyan shin tu rnam par phye ba thams cad mngon par sgrub pa nyid nye bar sgrub par mdzad do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rgyan shin tu rnam par phye ba thams cad mngon par sgrub pa nyid nye bar sgrub par mdzad do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: by means of the adornments of the body, speech and mind of the Tathagata, one has the power to accomplish all the different miracles for the different disciples connected with the Buddha.

original: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag mthu mnga' zhing thugs brtse ba dang ldan yang de nyid la zil gyis mi non pa'i lus rnam pa bcu po de dag nye bar sgrub pa mdzad kyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag mthu mnga' zhing thugs brtse ba dang ldan yang de nyid la zil gyis mi non pa'i lus rnam pa bcu po de dag nye bar sgrub pa mdzad kyi /
translated: Why do those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who have power and are compassionate, not crush those bodies with their supernatural power?

original: gzhan dag la ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag la ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why do those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who have power and compassion, not manifest those ten kinds of bodies that cannot be overcome by others?

original: 'di ltar de ni ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid kyi chos nyid thob pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid kyi chos nyid thob pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa ste /
translated: Because he has attained the reality of this very concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu thob pa de ni gzhan dag la med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu thob pa de ni gzhan dag la med do //
translated: That power of concentration is not found in others.

original: chos nyid thob pa de yang gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: chos nyid thob pa de yang gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: That attainment of reality is distinguished in two ways:

original: sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pas 'phangs pa ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pas 'phangs pa ni /
translated: that projected by previous manifest karma,

original: gang gi phyir sngon gyi smon lam gyi mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon gyi smon lam gyi mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because of the previous accomplishment of aspiration.üîΩThat projected by the power of the present cause,üîΩbecause of the power of the present cause.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rten gyi yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rten gyi @109b yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa de yang rang gi don dang / gzhan gyi don la brtsams nas rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /

translated: That is also to be understood as eightfold, beginning with one's own aim and the aim of another.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthar phyin pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas gzhir rnam par dag pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthar phyin pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas gzhir rnam par dag pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva's complete purity of the basis of superior intention is due to the complete purity of the basis of superior intention.

analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o//

original: de la lhag pa'i bsam pa ni dad pa dang 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i bsam pa ni dad pa dang 'dun pa ste /

translated: Because of the retention of the collections of names, words, and letters, which are preceded by those doors of letters.

analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ste /
translated: It is the Mahayana,

original: bshad pa'i chos la chos zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos la chos zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is called dharma in terms of the dharma that is to be explained.

original: yang de'i dbyings ni chos chen po dkar po'i dbyings te /
analyzed: yang de'i dbyings ni chos chen po dkar po'i dbyings te /
translated: Moreover, its dhatu is the great white dharma,üîΩbecause it is the cause of the great white dharma.

original: dge pa'i phyir chos zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge pa'i phyir chos zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is virtuous, it is called the Dharma.

original: rgyu nyid du shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rgyu nyid du shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The extreme determination of the cause itself is twofold.

original: rgyu nyid ni nam mkha' lta bu ste /
analyzed: rgyu nyid ni nam mkha' lta bu ste /
translated: The cause itself is like space,

original: de la brten nas byung ba'i gzugs rnams kyis zad pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi rtag pa sdug pa 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid du shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid ni gang gi phyir nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten nas byung ba'i gzugs rnams kyis zad pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi rtag pa sdug pa 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid du shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid ni gang gi phyir nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because the forms that arise in dependence on it are inexhaustible. The extreme determination of the cause itself that produces impermanent, attractive results is stated in the line ‚Äúup to the end of space.‚Äù

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba'i phyir 'bras bu rtag pa'i rgyu nyid du shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid ni gang gi phyir phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba'i phyir 'bras bu rtag pa'i rgyu nyid du shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid ni gang gi phyir phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The extreme determination of the cause itself that produces permanent results is stated in the line ‚Äúup to the end of time.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi don la zhugs pas che ba nyid du shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid ni gang gi phyir sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi dpung gnyen yin te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la zhugs pas che ba nyid du shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid ni gang gi phyir sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi dpung gnyen yin te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The extreme determination of greatness through engagement for the welfare of others is stated in the line ‚Äúthe protector of the entire world of sentient beings.‚Äù

original: shin tu rnam par nges pa brjod ma thag pa dang / 'di gnyis kyis ni smon lam de 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu nges par gnas pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan to //üîΩsangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sa la 'jug pa zhum pa med pas zhum pa med pa nyid du shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid de /üîΩde ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po de dag kho na yin te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par nges pa brjod ma thag pa dang / 'di gnyis kyis ni smon lam de 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu nges par gnas pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan to // sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sa la 'jug pa zhum pa med pas zhum pa med pa nyid du shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid de / de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po de dag kho na yin te /
translated: The two just mentioned, the very certain and the very ascertained, demonstrate that the vow is not fixed in either cyclic existence or in nirvana.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yang dag par 'grub pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yang dag par 'grub pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The very certain and the very ascertained are the ten bodhisattva stages, because they are the basis for the attainment of the knowledge of a buddha.

original: 'dir yang shin tu rnam par nges pa ni yan lag go //
analyzed: 'dir yang shin tu rnam par nges pa ni yan lag go //
translated: Here, the very certain is the member,

original: lhag ma ni nye ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: lhag ma ni nye ba'i yan lag go //
translated: and the rest are the proximate members.

original: de gnyis shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid 'dra ba'o //
translated: They are similar in that they are both very certain.

original: rnam pa gzhan nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: They are dissimilar in that they are of different types.

original: 'du ba ni bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'du ba ni bsdus pa ste /
translated: The collection is the accumulation.

original: yan lag gi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag gi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach the branches of the perfections.

original: rgyas pa ni rnam pa dbye ba ste /
analyzed: rgyas pa ni rnam pa dbye ba ste /
translated: Extensive means differentiated.

original: nye ba'i yan lag gi rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nye ba'i yan lag gi rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to teach the aspects of the branches.

original: 'jig rten gyis khams 'jig pa dang 'chags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis khams 'jig pa dang 'chags pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the destruction and evolution of the world.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa bcu po de dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa bcu po de dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are the ten stages of the bodhisattvas arranged?

original: de mi mthun pa'i phyogs sa bcu po dag gi gnyen po bcu ste /
analyzed: de mi mthun pa'i phyogs sa bcu po dag gi gnyen po bcu ste /
translated: The ten antidotes to the ten counteragents to those stages.

original: de mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the counteragents?

original: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / lus la sogs pas sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa dang / thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i chos rnams brjed pas mun pa'i tshul can nyid @112a * //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / lus la sogs pas sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa dang / thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i chos rnams brjed pas mun pa'i tshul can nyid @112a * //
translated: The state of ordinary person, the wrong practice of body, etc. with regard to sentient beings, the state of darkness due to forgetting the teachings of hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: dang ; 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pas bsdus pa lhan cig skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba de yang phra ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rang gi yid la byed pa la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: dang ; 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pas bsdus pa lhan cig skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba de yang phra ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rang gi yid la byed pa la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: and the subtle innate afflicted proclivities that are included in the afflicted view of the self and so on, are to be known as subtle because they are subtle aspects, because they focus on one's own mental activity,

original: kun du 'byung ba ring du song ba yin pa'i phyir phra bar rig par bya ba dang / theg pa dman pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mtshan ma rags pa kun du 'byung ba dang / mtshan ma phra ba kun du 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: kun du 'byung ba ring du song ba yin pa'i phyir phra bar rig par bya ba dang / theg pa dman pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mtshan ma rags pa kun du 'byung ba dang / mtshan ma phra ba kun du 'byung ba dang /
translated: because they are distant from arising, because of parinirvƒÅ·πáa through the Individual Vehicle, because of the arising of gross signs, because of the arising of subtle signs,

original: mtshan ma med pa nyid du mngon par 'du byed pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / chos rnams la dbang ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa nyid du mngon par 'du byed pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / chos rnams la dbang ma thob pa'o //
translated: because of the manifest activity of signlessness, because of the nonmanifest activity of benefiting sentient beings, and because of not obtaining power over phenomena.

original: ci'i phyir sa bcu po rnams rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa bcu po rnams rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are the ten levels respectively called the Joyous and so on?

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas 'phags pa nyid bla na med pa thog mar thob pas mchog tu dga' ba rgya che ba'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas 'phags pa nyid bla na med pa thog mar thob pas mchog tu dga' ba rgya che ba'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: It is the Joyous because of the joy of the first attainment of the state of a Saint, which is the abode of the perfection of one's own and others' aims.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kun nas slong ba nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad sel ba'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kun nas slong ba nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad sel ba'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is the Immaculate because of the purity of morality, which removes all the stains of addictions that motivate immorality.

original: ji ltar thos pa la sogs pa'i chos snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'od byed pa ste /üîΩde ma brjed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnyon mongs pa'i shing bsregs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can no //
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa la sogs pa'i chos snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'od byed pa ste / de ma brjed pa'i phyir ro // nyon mongs pa'i shing bsregs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can no //
translated: It is the Radiant because of the illumination of the Dharma, such as hearing, etc.üîΩIt is the Brilliant because of the brilliance of the Dharma, such as hearing, etc.,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la mkhas pas mnan par shin tu dka' ba'i phyir shin tu sbyang dka'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la mkhas pas mnan par shin tu dka' ba'i phyir shin tu sbyang dka'o //
translated: It is the Difficult to Overcome because of the difficulty of overcoming the addictions, which are like a forest fire.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du byed de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du byed de /
translated: It is the Manifested because of the manifestation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bar chad dang bcas par mang du mngon du byed pa'i phyir mngon du gyur to //
analyzed: bar chad dang bcas par mang du mngon du byed pa'i phyir mngon du gyur to //
translated: It is manifest because it manifests many times with obstacles.

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas par sbyor ba'i mthar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir dang ; 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dman pa las shin tu 'da' ba'i phyir ring du song ba'o //üîΩrnam par smin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas par sbyor ba'i mthar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir dang ; 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dman pa las shin tu 'da' ba'i phyir ring du song ba'o // rnam par smin pa kho na ste /
translated: It is far-reaching because it is the culmination of the practice of the signless stage and because it transcends the mundane and supramundane lower paths.

original: rang gi ngang gis mtshan ma mi 'byung bas mi g-yo ba'o //üîΩso so yang dag par rig pa'i stobs kyis chos ston te /
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis mtshan ma mi 'byung bas mi g-yo ba'o // so so yang dag par rig pa'i stobs kyis chos ston te /
translated: It is immovable because it is not moved by either the signs of the compounded or the signs of the uncompounded.

original: gzhan gyi don byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros can no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros can no //
translated: It is good intellect because it is endowed with the performance of the benefit of others through the teaching of the Dharma by the power of analytical knowledges.

original: chos la dbang chen po'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir chos kyi sprin te /
analyzed: chos la dbang chen po'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir chos kyi sprin te /
translated: It is cloud of Dharma because it is the basis of the great power over the Dharma,

original: rgyal bu rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur pa dang rang gi rgyal srid la dbang thob pa ltar chos kyi rje nyid du dbang bskur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal bu rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur pa dang rang gi rgyal srid la dbang thob pa ltar chos kyi rje nyid du dbang bskur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: like a prince who is consecrated as a regent and obtains power over his own kingdom, so too, he is consecrated as the lord of the Dharma.

original: de la gnas pa la yang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag yod pas rang dbang med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: de la gnas pa la yang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag yod pas rang dbang med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The state of abiding in that is the adverse element, because of the heedlessness of the obscurations to omniscience.

original: de'i @112b gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i @112b gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The stage of the Tathagata is established as the antidote to that.

original: de las 'di dag ni sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa bcu'i gnas skabs ni mngal na gnas pa'i gnas skabs dang 'dra ba'i rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las 'di dag ni sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa bcu'i gnas skabs ni mngal na gnas pa'i gnas skabs dang 'dra ba'i rig par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the ten stages of the bodhisattvas should be known as similar to the state of being in the womb, because they are accompanied by obscurations.

original: shes bya'i spyod yul thams cad nyams su myong bas sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs ni 'bras bu yongs su grub pas btsas pa'i gnas skabs dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i spyod yul thams cad nyams su myong bas sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs ni 'bras bu yongs su grub pas btsas pa'i gnas skabs dang 'dra ste /
translated: The stage of the Buddha, through the experience of the entire domain of the knowable, is similar to the state of being born, through the completion of the fruit.

original: btsas pa ni dbang po'i spyod yul thams cad nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: btsas pa ni dbang po'i spyod yul thams cad nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
translated: For, just as one who is born experiences the entire domain of the senses,

original: de la mngal na gnas pa'i gnas skabs bcu ni /
analyzed: de la mngal na gnas pa'i gnas skabs bcu ni /
translated: In this regard, the ten states of being in the womb are:

original: nur nur po'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / mer mer po'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / nyol nyol po'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / sha ma khrang ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / lus dang mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / rang bzhin dang mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang /üîΩlas dang bcas pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: nur nur po'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / mer mer po'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / nyol nyol po'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / sha ma khrang ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / lus dang mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / rang bzhin dang mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / las dang bcas pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: the stage of old age, and the stage of death.üîΩThe stage of the body is threefold:

original: dbang po yongs su rdzogs pa dang / mtshan yongs su rdzogs pa dang / chu zheng yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su rdzogs pa dang / mtshan yongs su rdzogs pa dang / chu zheng yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: the stage of the complete sense faculties, the stage of the complete sexual characteristics, and the stage of the complete size.

original: sa rnams ni de dag dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa rnams ni de dag dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The stages should be understood in the same way.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag bdag gis ni gang na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po 'di dag mi gsung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab 'byam de ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag bdag gis ni gang na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po 'di dag mi gsung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab 'byam de ma mthong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúO sons of the Victorious Ones, I have not seen any buddha field in the infinite universes where the Thus-Gone Ones do not teach these ten bodhisattva stages.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag gang 'dis rab tu dbye ba rnam par dgod pa bstan pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su sbyong ba chos kyi sgo snang ba 'di yang dag phul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag gang 'dis rab tu dbye ba rnam par dgod pa bstan pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su sbyong ba chos kyi sgo snang ba 'di yang dag phul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: O sons of the victors, this is the highest light of the Dharma gateway that teaches the arrangement of the divisions and purifies the bodhisattva path of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag gang 'dis rnam par dgod pa shes pa'i gnas skabs 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag gang 'dis rnam par dgod pa shes pa'i gnas skabs 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: O sons of the victors, this state of knowing the arrangement is inconceivable.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab 'byam thams cad na 'di rnams gsung ba nyid dang / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di yang dag phul nyid du brjod pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab 'byam thams cad na 'di rnams gsung ba nyid dang / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di yang dag phul nyid du brjod pa ste /
translated: All the buddhas in all the infinite buddha realms are teaching this, and this Dharma discourse is being expressed as the highest.

original: 'khor de mgu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor de mgu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in order to please the retinue.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni der 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni der 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: In this regard, a buddha realm is so called because it is the place where a buddha arises.

original: 'bras s'a lu'i zhing bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras s'a lu'i zhing bzhin no //
translated: It is like a field of rice.

original: rab 'byam yang de yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byam yang de yin te /
translated: It is infinite because it is infinite.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa'i don du de nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu rab tu shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa'i don du de nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu rab tu shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and then in other world systems for the sake of the deeds of a Buddha.

original: gsung ba zhes bya ba ni gsung ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gsung ba zhes bya ba ni gsung ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Speech is twofold:

original: @113a * // lung gi don du bstan pa dang / khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dang / gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: @113a * // lung gi don du bstan pa dang / khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dang / gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the meaning of the scriptures and the instruction and precept for the sake of understanding.

original: sems dpa' chen po ni chen po gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po ni chen po gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The great being should be understood as having three greatnesses:

original: go cha chen po dang / 'jug pa chen po dang / 'phags pa chen po'o //
analyzed: go cha chen po dang / 'jug pa chen po dang / 'phags pa chen po'o //
translated: the greatness of armor, the greatness of engagement, and the greatness of the superior being.

original: de la go cha ni smon lam 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: de la go cha ni smon lam 'debs pa'o //
translated: Among them, armor is the vow.

original: 'jug pa ni byang chub chen po der zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni byang chub chen po der zhugs pa'o //
translated: Engagement is the entry into that great enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa ni lam der 'phags pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni ji ltar yang dag phul du gyur pa de ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni lam der 'phags pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni ji ltar yang dag phul du gyur pa de ston to //
translated: Superior being is the purification of the path of the noble bodhisattva. This shows how he is the best.

original: 'di ni chos kyi sgo yang yin la chos kyi sgo gzhan rnams snang bar gyur pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi sgo yang yin la chos kyi sgo gzhan rnams snang bar gyur pa yang yin te /
translated: This is a Dharma gateway, and it is the illumination of other Dharma gateways.

original: theg pa chen po'i don thams cad snang ba'i phyir chos kyi sgo snang ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i don thams cad snang ba'i phyir chos kyi sgo snang ba'o //
translated: The light of the Dharma-gate is the light of the Dharma-gate because it illuminates all the meanings of the Great Vehicle.

original: chos kyi sgo ni chos kyi rnam grangs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo ni chos kyi rnam grangs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The Dharma-gate should be understood as a Dharma-category.

original: yang dag phul ni chos thams cad pas phul du phyin te mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag phul ni chos thams cad pas phul du phyin te mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest truth is the highest truth because it is the highest, the supreme, of all dharmas.

original: gang 'dis rab tu dbye ba rnam par dgod pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'jig rten pa'i shes pas shes par bya ba yin par ston to //
analyzed: gang 'dis rab tu dbye ba rnam par dgod pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'jig rten pa'i shes pas shes par bya ba yin par ston to //
translated: The statement by this, the classification is established shows that the Dharma-category is to be known by worldly knowledge.

analyzed: de ltar don zab pa de ji ltar nus pa de bzhin du bshad kyang dka' ste /

original: 'gro bas thos na der ni rmongs par 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: rmongs par ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: don la sgra ji bzhin du 'dzin pa'o /

analyzed: thos na zhes bya ba ni thos nas de bshad par dka' ba ni de lta bu yin no //

original: sems kyi sa la bdag med rig nas ni //
analyzed: sems kyi sa la bdag med rig nas ni //

analyzed: phyogs bcu thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byam thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi @121b dkyil 'khor rnams su chos bstan par byin gyi rlabs kyis brlabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' snang bar byas zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he illuminates the bodhisattvas blessed to teach the Dharma in the retinues of all the tathagatas in all the world systems of the ten directions.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i sgra 'byin pa'i phyir bskul ba'i las byed pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i sgra 'byin pa'i phyir bskul ba'i las byed pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The action of urging is that, by emitting the sound of verses, he urges the bodhisattvas to practice.üîΩBecause he urges the bodhisattvas to practice by emitting the sound of verses in all the world systems of the ten directions.

original: 'od zer stug po'i sprin gyi dra ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa de las 'di lta bu'i sgra 'di 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer stug po'i sprin gyi dra ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa de las 'di lta bu'i sgra 'di 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //

original: lus gnyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: lus gnyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the two kinds of bodies?

original: skar mda' lta bu'i lus ni gang gi tshe khams gzhan dag tu 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: skar mda' lta bu'i lus ni gang gi tshe khams gzhan dag tu 'gro ba'o //

original: nyi ma lta bu'i lus ni gang gi che sprin stug po'i dra ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa byas te 'dug nas rgya chen po gcig gis thams cad snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma lta bu'i lus ni gang gi che sprin stug po'i dra ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa byas te 'dug nas rgya chen po gcig gis thams cad snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: The sun-like body is when one sits in the house of the net of thick clouds and illuminates everything with one great light.

original: de ltar 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag na gcig tu gyur pa lta bur phan tshun lta bas bshad pa dang / mnyan pa sla bar gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag na gcig tu gyur pa lta bur phan tshun lta bas bshad pa dang / mnyan pa sla bar gyur to //
translated: Thus, in those assemblies, it was easy to see and hear the explanations, as if they were in one place, looking at each other.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyis bskul ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyis bskul ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the Buddha's encouragement:üîΩThose equal to the unequaled, equal to space,

original: mi mnyam mnyam pa nam mkha' mnyam pa dag / stobs bcu khyu mchog tshogs rab mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: mi mnyam mnyam pa nam mkha' mnyam pa dag / stobs bcu khyu mchog tshogs rab mtha' yas pa //
translated: the supreme leaders with the ten powers, the infinite assemblies,

original: lha dang mi yi nang na mchog rnams kyi //
analyzed: lha dang mi yi nang na mchog rnams kyi //
translated: the supreme ones among gods and humans,

original: sh'akya'i rigs skyes chos la byin rlab mdzad //
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs skyes chos la byin rlab mdzad //
translated: Born into the ≈öƒÅkya clan, you bestow blessings upon the Dharma.

original: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi mthu //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi mthu //
translated: The power of the Sugatas,

original: chos kyi rgyal po rnams kyi mdzod //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po rnams kyi mdzod //
translated: The treasury of the Dharma Kings,üîΩThe vast and sublime conduct,

original: spyod pa dam pa rgya chen dang // ye shes sa rab phye ste shod //
analyzed: spyod pa dam pa rgya chen dang // ye shes sa rab phye ste shod //
translated: Please explain the stages of wisdom.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs gtso bo 'di //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs gtso bo 'di //
translated: Those who hear this foremost Dharma discourse

original: gang rnams rna lam grag de dag / bde gshegs rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs //
analyzed: gang rnams rna lam grag de dag / bde gshegs rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs //
translated: Are blessed by the Sugatas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bzung //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bzung //

original: sa bcu rngul dang rnam bral ba //
analyzed: sa bcu rngul dang rnam bral ba //
translated: And free from the stains of the ten grounds.

original: mthar gyis rdzogs par byas nas ni //
analyzed: mthar gyis rdzogs par byas nas ni //

original: stobs bcu dag kyang thob gyur nas //
analyzed: stobs bcu dag kyang thob gyur nas //

original: rgyal ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: rgyal ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin //

analyzed: the tshom med par gyur pa dang // rgya mtsho'i chu nang gnas gyur tam //
translated: Whether dwelling in the ocean waters

analyzed: sreg pa'i bskal tshe 'phos nas yang //
translated: Or reborn during the fire kalpa,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos 'gyur //

original: ye shes sa yi lam gyi mchog /
analyzed: ye shes sa yi lam gyi mchog /
translated: The supreme path of the stage of wisdom,

original: 'jug dang gnas dang 'phar ba dang // spyod pa nyid kyi yul rnams ni //
analyzed: 'jug dang gnas dang 'phar ba dang // spyod pa nyid kyi yul rnams ni //
translated: The objects of entry, abiding, leaping, and conduct,

original: go rims bzhin du legs par shod //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du legs par shod //
translated: please explain them in order.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po dang / gnyis pas ni gang dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa dang / gang gi phyir byin gyis brlabs pa de dag gi bsngags pa mdzad na ni byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po dang / gnyis pas ni gang dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa dang / gang gi phyir byin gyis brlabs pa de dag gi bsngags pa mdzad na ni byin gyis brlabs pa ste /

original: ci zhig ston zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig ston zhe na /
translated: What does he show?

original: gtso bo rnams kyis ma bsgos sam /
analyzed: gtso bo rnams kyis ma bsgos sam /
translated: If the chief ones do not consecrate,

original: mchog gi las byed du ma bcug na /
analyzed: mchog gi las byed du ma bcug na /
translated: or if they do not appoint someone to do the supreme work,

original: de byed par mi 'gyur @122a * //
analyzed: de byed par mi 'gyur @122a * //
translated: it will not be done.

original: ro ; / de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos gang dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i bsngags pa ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ro ; / de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos gang dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i bsngags pa ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the praise of those who bless in the first verse?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: lha dang mi yi nang na mchog rnams kyis //
analyzed: lha dang mi yi nang na mchog rnams kyis //

original: byin rlabs mdzad ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byin rlabs mdzad ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: are said to consecrate.

original: lha dang mi'i mchog gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i mchog gang yin zhe na /
translated: Who are the supreme ones among gods and humans?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams so //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: chos kyi rgyal por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
