original: ji ltar de dag chos kyi rgyal po nyid yin par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag chos kyi rgyal po nyid yin par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should they be understood as kings of the Dharma?

original: rgyal po'i phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The excellence of a king is fourfold:

original: dbang phun sum tshogs pa dang / mthu phun sum tshogs pa dang / zhabs 'bring phun sum tshogs pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phun sum tshogs pa dang / mthu phun sum tshogs pa dang / zhabs 'bring phun sum tshogs pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: excellence of power, excellence of influence, excellence of retinue, and excellence of lineage.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbang phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbang phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the excellence of power of the Buddhas?

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: It is the complete knowledge of all the aspects of the objects of knowledge.

original: des de dag sems dang ye shes la dbang brnyes nas /
analyzed: des de dag sems dang ye shes la dbang brnyes nas /
translated: By that power, they have attained mastery over thought and intuition,

original: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du bde bar gnas pa bla na med pa sku nyams su bstar to //
analyzed: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du bde bar gnas pa bla na med pa sku nyams su bstar to //
translated: and they experience the unexcelled bliss of abiding in whatever way they wish.

original: de 'dir ji skad du bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dir ji skad du bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is that taught here?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: It is taught by the unexcelled equality of the Buddhas, because of their omniscience.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa legs par bcom pas /üîΩ'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi gos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa legs par bcom pas / 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi gos pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he has well subdued the afflictions together with their traces,

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: he is equal to space, because he is unstained by any worldly thing.

original: mi mnyam pa ni sangs rgyas rnams te /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ni sangs rgyas rnams te /
translated: The unequaled is the Buddhas,

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams dang ngo //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams dang ngo //
translated: and the others are the other sentient beings.

original: mi mnyam pa de dag dang mnyam pa ni de dag ni chos kyi skus mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa de dag dang mnyam pa ni de dag ni chos kyi skus mnyam pa'o //
translated: Equality with those unequaled is equality with them through the Dharma Body.

original: mi mnyam pa rnams zhes ci'i phyir de skad mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa rnams zhes ci'i phyir de skad mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called unequaled?

original: de dag ni mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are taught to be equality.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthu phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthu phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of the powers of the Buddhas?

original: stobs bcu rnams te /
analyzed: stobs bcu rnams te /
translated: It is the ten powers.

original: de rnams kyis ni de dag gis gzhan smra ba dang / bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: de rnams kyis ni de dag gis gzhan smra ba dang / bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
translated: By them he surpasses all the adversaries and opponents.

original: de 'dir ji skad bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dir ji skad bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it taught here?

original: stobs bcu'i khyu mchog nyid kyis so //
analyzed: stobs bcu'i khyu mchog nyid kyis so //
translated: By the supremacy of the ten powers.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhabs 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhabs 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the excellence of the retinue of the Buddhas?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos ris bdun gyis bsdus pa rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos ris bdun gyis bsdus pa rnams so //
translated: It is the Bodhisattvas and the seven groups of the Hearers.

original: de 'dir ji skad du bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dir ji skad du bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it shown here?

original: tshogs rab mtha' yas pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: tshogs rab mtha' yas pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By the excellence and infinity of the retinue.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams so //üîΩrab ni 'jig @122b rten las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams so // rab ni 'jig @122b rten las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The excellence is that of the Bodhisattvas, etc.

original: de dag mtha' yas pa ni grangs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag mtha' yas pa ni grangs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is infinite because it is innumerable.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rigs phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rigs phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the excellence of the family of the Buddhas?

original: gang rigs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang rigs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is the excellence of the family itself.

original: de 'dir ji skad du bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dir ji skad du bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it shown here?

original: sh'akya'i rigs skyes pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs skyes pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By the fact that he is born in the Sakya family.

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rigs brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rigs brjod ce na /
translated: Why does the Lord himself proclaim the family?

original: mngon sum nyid kyi phyir dang / 'di nyid kyi phyir chos la byin gyis brlabs so zhes sbyar ba'i phyir ro //üîΩchos la zhes bya ba ni chos la gnas pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyi phyir dang / 'di nyid kyi phyir chos la byin gyis brlabs so zhes sbyar ba'i phyir ro // chos la zhes bya ba ni chos la gnas pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: because it is direct perception, and because of this very fact, it is applied as the consecration of the Dharma.üîΩThe word Dharma means the consecration of the Dharma, that is, the consecration of the Dharma-realm.

original: de la byin gyis brlabs pa mdzad ces bya ba ni yan lag go //
analyzed: de la byin gyis brlabs pa mdzad ces bya ba ni yan lag go //
translated: The word consecration means the consecration of the Dharma-realm.

original: byin gyi rlabs de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: This consecration should be understood as twofold:

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa ni sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa ni sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the consecration of the excellent abode, because it is the consecration of the Buddha;

original: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa ni chos smra ba 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa ni chos smra ba 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the consecration of the excellent result, because it is the result of the expounder of the Dharma.

original: lha dang mi yi mchog rnams zhes bya ba ni yan lag go ;
analyzed: lha dang mi yi mchog rnams zhes bya ba ni yan lag go ;
translated: The words the best of gods and men are the member.

original: / lhag ma ni nye ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: / lhag ma ni nye ba'i yan lag go //
translated: The rest are the secondary members.

original: 'o na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gang gi phyir byin gyis brlabs pa de'i bsngags pa ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gang gi phyir byin gyis brlabs pa de'i bsngags pa ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: Now, how should the praise of that consecration be understood in the second verse?

original: chos kyi rgyal po de dag gis chos kyi mdzod rnam par 'byed par bya ba'i phyir byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po de dag gis chos kyi mdzod rnam par 'byed par bya ba'i phyir byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: Those Dharma kings have blessed it in order to open the treasury of the Dharma.

original: 'dir chos kyi mdzod de'i bsngags pa yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir chos kyi mdzod de'i bsngags pa yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, the praise of that treasury of the Dharma should be understood in two ways:

original: don phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshig 'bru phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: don phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshig 'bru phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: in terms of its perfection of meaning and in terms of its perfection of phrasing.

original: don phun sum tshogs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: don phun sum tshogs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of meaning?

original: gang gi phyir spyod pa dam pa rgya chen zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyod pa dam pa rgya chen zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is the highest conduct, which is vast.

original: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Conduct is the practice of the bodhisattvas.

original: lam gang yin pa dang / tshogs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lam gang yin pa dang / tshogs gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the path and the equipment.

original: de yang don dam pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas dam pa'o //
analyzed: de yang don dam pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas dam pa'o //
translated: It is the highest because it is endowed with ultimate intuition.

original: mthu'i khyad par dang ldan pas rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: mthu'i khyad par dang ldan pas rgya che ba'o //
translated: It is vast because it is endowed with the special power.

original: de ltar 'di'i zab pa nyid dang / rgya che ba nyid kyang yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i zab pa nyid dang / rgya che ba nyid kyang yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, its profundity and vastness are also taught.

original: tshig 'bru phun sum tshogs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: tshig 'bru phun sum tshogs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of phrasing?

original: gang gi phyir ye shes sa rab phye ste zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ye shes sa rab phye ste zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Because the stages of wisdom are well differentiated.

original: ye shes kyi sa rab tu phye ba rnam pa bcu gcig po 'di dag gis so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sa rab tu phye ba rnam pa bcu gcig po 'di dag gis so //
translated: It is by these eleven kinds of well differentiated stages of wisdom.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di las sangs rgyas kyi mthu nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos ston par yongs su bstan pa gang yin pa de ni kha cig sangs rgyas la bdag nyid la mthu med nas gzhan la tshol to snyam du dbang @123a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di las sangs rgyas kyi mthu nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos ston par yongs su bstan pa gang yin pa de ni kha cig sangs rgyas la bdag nyid la mthu med nas gzhan la tshol to snyam du dbang @123a * //
translated: In this verse, the teaching of the Buddha Dharma by the power of the Buddha alone is shown, because some, lacking the power themselves, think that they should seek it from others.

original: za ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: za ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is to completely abandon the attitude of being a master.

original: de ltar chos bshad par bskul nas bshad na dus gsum du gzhan dag gi phan yon ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ston te /
analyzed: de ltar chos bshad par bskul nas bshad na dus gsum du gzhan dag gi phan yon ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ston te /
translated: Thus, having been urged to teach the Dharma, if one teaches it, the benefits to others in the three times are shown in three verses.

original: nyan pa'i dus dang / sgrub pa'i dus dang / tshe rabs brjes pa'i dus so //
analyzed: nyan pa'i dus dang / sgrub pa'i dus dang / tshe rabs brjes pa'i dus so //
translated: The time of listening, the time of practice, and the time of rebirth.

original: de la nyan pa'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs pa nyid dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang bzung ba nyid de don du na sangs rgyas so snyam du bzung ba ni phan yon no //
analyzed: de la nyan pa'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs pa nyid dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang bzung ba nyid de don du na sangs rgyas so snyam du bzung ba ni phan yon no //
translated: At the time of listening, one should think that the Dharma is the Buddha's blessing, and that the Bodhisattvas have taken it up. In fact, it is the Buddha. This is the benefit.

original: sgrub pa'i dus nas bcu po dag mthar gyis yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dus nas bcu po dag mthar gyis yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: At the time of practice, one should gradually complete the ten perfections.

original: yongs su rdzogs nas kyang stobs bcu brnyes pas bdag nyid sangs rgyas nyid du bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs nas kyang stobs bcu brnyes pas bdag nyid sangs rgyas nyid du bskyed pa'o //
translated: Having completed them, one should generate the Buddhahood in oneself by attaining the ten powers.

original: tshe rabs brjes pa'i dus na ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro mi khom par skyes pa'i klu'i 'jig rten dang / lha tshe ring po'i 'od gsal la sogs pa gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi nang du yang chos 'di rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs brjes pa'i dus na ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro mi khom par skyes pa'i klu'i 'jig rten dang / lha tshe ring po'i 'od gsal la sogs pa gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi nang du yang chos 'di rnyed pa'o //
translated: At the time of rebirth, one should find this Dharma in the world of the Nagas, in the happy and unhappy migrations, in the unfavorable births, and in the long-lived gods of the Abhasvara and other heavens in the world of form.

original: 'di nyan pa thams cad kyis phan yon 'di 'thob pa'i skal ba yod dam /
analyzed: 'di nyan pa thams cad kyis phan yon 'di 'thob pa'i skal ba yod dam /
translated: Do all who listen to this have the good fortune to obtain this benefit?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: It is said that they do not.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it like?

original: the tshom med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: the tshom med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase without doubt means

original: nges pa'i chos 'di la mos pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i chos 'di la mos pa'o //
translated: that one has conviction in this Dharma of certainty.

original: de ltar bskul ba dang / bshad pa'i phan yon brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar bskul ba dang / bshad pa'i phan yon brjod nas /
translated: Having thus exhorted and stated the benefits of the explanation,

original: ye shes sa rab phye ste zhes gang gsungs pa de dmigs pa'i go rims dang ; rtogs pa'i go rims dang / sgrub pa'i go rims dang / go rims rnam pa gsum gyis tshigs su bcad pa drug pa las lung stsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: ye shes sa rab phye ste zhes gang gsungs pa de dmigs pa'i go rims dang ; rtogs pa'i go rims dang / sgrub pa'i go rims dang / go rims rnam pa gsum gyis tshigs su bcad pa drug pa las lung stsal bar mdzad do //
translated: the verse beginning with the words, the stages of wisdom and the stages of the grounds refers to the six verses that were spoken in the scriptures in terms of three kinds of stages: the stage of the object, the stage of realization, and the stage of practice.

original: rtsa ba dang po gnyis pa dang / bzhi pa rnams kyis bstan to //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang po gnyis pa dang / bzhi pa rnams kyis bstan to //
translated: The first, second, and fourth roots are the stages of the object.

original: go rims su shod cig ces bya ba ni thams cad du sbyar ro //
analyzed: go rims su shod cig ces bya ba ni thams cad du sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase explain in order is to be applied to all the stages.

original: de la ye shes kyi sa'i khams ni sa bcu bstan pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la ye shes kyi sa'i khams ni sa bcu bstan pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Among them, the stage of wisdom and the stage of the constituents are the ten grounds that are taught.

original: gang la dmigs gang la brten nas sa de dag tu ye shes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang la dmigs gang la brten nas sa de dag tu ye shes 'byung ba'o //
translated: They are the grounds on which wisdom arises in dependence on the objects on which it focuses.

original: 'jug pa ni sa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni sa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Engagement is the engagement in the grounds.

original: gnas pa ni ji srid dus gzhan dag tu ma 'phar gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni ji srid dus gzhan dag tu ma 'phar gyi bar du'o //
translated: Abiding is for as long as one does not progress to other grounds.

original: 'phar ba ni sa gzhan dag tu 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'phar ba ni sa gzhan dag tu 'gro ba'o //
translated: The leap is the going to another stage.

original: spyod pa ni ji ltar sgrub pa ni de dag 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang 'phar ba dang 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni ji ltar sgrub pa ni de dag 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang 'phar ba dang 'grub pa'o //
translated: The practice is the accomplishment of the practice, which is the entry, the abiding, the leap, and the accomplishment.

original: spyod pa de nyid kyi rgyu ba rnam pa mang po ni spyad pa'i yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa de nyid kyi rgyu ba rnam pa mang po ni spyad pa'i yul zhes bya'o //
translated: The field of practice is the many kinds of practice of that very practice.

original: lung sbyin pa 'di ci dgos she na /
analyzed: lung sbyin pa 'di ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the purpose of the prediction?

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa nyid thams cad bshad do zhes phyis yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa nyid thams cad bshad do zhes phyis yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to generate faith later, by saying, All this is explained by the Buddha himself.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo @123b rje'i snying pos phyogs bcur rnam par bltas nas 'khor rnams dad pa rgya cher bskyed pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo @123b rje'i snying pos phyogs bcur rnam par bltas nas 'khor rnams dad pa rgya cher bskyed pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vajra garbha, looking in the ten directions, spoke these verses in order to greatly generate faith in the assembly:

original: phra zhing shes dka' drang srong chen po'i lam //
analyzed: phra zhing shes dka' drang srong chen po'i lam //
translated: The path of the great sages is subtle and difficult to know,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: ci'i phyir phyogs bcur rnam par blta zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phyogs bcur rnam par blta zhe na /
translated: Why does he look in the ten directions?

original: bdag nyid nga rgyal med pa dang // nye mgon med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid nga rgyal med pa dang // nye mgon med par ston pa'o //
translated: and the absence of pride in oneself, and the absence of a protector other than the Master.

original: 'khor rnams dang pa rgya cher bskyed pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa smras zhes bya ba ni sa bstan pa mnyan par nyams bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor rnams dang pa rgya cher bskyed pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa smras zhes bya ba ni sa bstan pa mnyan par nyams bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He spoke these verses in order to generate great faith in the assembly, in order to generate a delight in listening to the teaching of the stages.

original: de la dad pa zhes bya ba ni sems gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de la dad pa zhes bya ba ni sems gsal ba ste /
translated: Therein, faith is the clarity of mind.

original: rnyog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of turbidity.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: And it should be understood as twofold:

original: don gyi che ba nyid la dad pa ni don gang thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi che ba nyid la dad pa ni don gang thob par bya ba'o //
translated: faith in the greatness of the object, which is the goal to be attained;

original: bstan pa'i che ba nyid la dad pa ni gang gis thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i che ba nyid la dad pa ni gang gis thob par byed pa'o //
translated: and faith in the greatness of the teaching, which is the means of attaining it.

original: de la don gyi che ba nyid la dad pa ni tshigs su bcad pa lnga po dag gis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la don gyi che ba nyid la dad pa ni tshigs su bcad pa lnga po dag gis rig par bya'o //
translated: Therein, faith in the greatness of the object is to be understood through the first five verses.

original: don gyi che ba nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: don gyi che ba nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the greatness of the object?

original: de'i zab pa nyid gang yin pa'o//
analyzed: de'i zab pa nyid gang yin pa'o//
translated: It is the profundity of the object.

original: de bas na zab pa nyid de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na zab pa nyid de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that profundity,

original: phra zhing shes dka' drang srong chen po'i lam //
analyzed: phra zhing shes dka' drang srong chen po'i lam //
translated: The path of the great seers is subtle and difficult to fathom.

original: brtag med rtog bral shin tu reg par dka' //
analyzed: brtag med rtog bral shin tu reg par dka' //
translated: It is not an object of scrutiny, free from conceptualization, and extremely difficult to realize.

original: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: ci'i dbang du byas nas gsungs she na /üîΩye shes kyi sa ste /
analyzed: ci'i dbang du byas nas gsungs she na / ye shes kyi sa ste /
translated: With respect to what is it said?üîΩIt is said with respect to the stage of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar de nyid kyi dbang du byas pas 'og nas kyang ye shes mngon par sgrub ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid kyi dbang du byas pas 'og nas kyang ye shes mngon par sgrub ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said below that ‚Äúwisdom is accomplished.‚Äù

original: de la phra zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la phra zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is subtle there?

original: de ni shes dka' drang srong chen po'i lam //
analyzed: de ni shes dka' drang srong chen po'i lam //
translated: It is difficult to know, the path of the great sages.

original: zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'di ltar bshad pa na shes par dka' la drang srong chen po rnams te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad pa na shes par dka' la drang srong chen po rnams te /
translated: When it is explained, it is difficult to know, and it is the path of the great sages.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi lam yang yin pas de'i phyir phra ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi lam yang yin pas de'i phyir phra ba'o //
translated: Since it is the path of the buddhas, it is therefore subtle.

original: lam ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: lam ni rgyu ste /
translated: The path is the cause,

original: gang gi drang srong chen po'i dngos por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi drang srong chen po'i dngos por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: by which one becomes a great sage.

original: phra ba de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: phra ba de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: That subtlety should be understood as twofold:

original: bshad pa'i dus na phra ba nyid dang / thob pa'i dus na phra ba nyid de go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bshad pa'i dus na phra ba nyid dang / thob pa'i dus na phra ba nyid de go rims bzhin no //
translated: subtlety at the time of explanation and subtlety at the time of attainment, respectively.

original: ci'i phyir de shes par dka' zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de shes par dka' zhe na /
translated: Why is it difficult to know?

original: 'di ltar de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni /
translated: Because it is said:

original: brtag med rtog bral zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: brtag med rtog bral zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is not an object of scrutiny, free from conceptualization.

original: de la brtag tu med pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brtag tu med pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not an object of scrutiny because it is not an object of conceptualization.

original: rtog bral ni rang gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rtog bral ni rang gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro /
translated: It is free from conceptualization because it is nonconceptual by nature.üîΩBecause it is the path of the great sages, it is called subtle.

original: gang gi phyir drang srong chen po'i lam du gyur pa de'i phyir phra ba zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir drang srong chen po'i lam du gyur pa de'i phyir phra ba zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it subtle?

original: 'di ltar de ni shin tu reg par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni shin tu reg par dka' ba ste /
translated: Because it is very difficult to touch,

original: shin tu thob par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu thob par dka' ba'o //
translated: very difficult to attain.

original: @124a * // 'di ni de'i phra ba nyid do //
analyzed: @124a * // 'di ni de'i phra ba nyid do //
translated: This is its subtlety.

original: ci'i phyir de shin tu reg par dka' zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de shin tu reg par dka' zhe na /
translated: Why is it very difficult to touch?

original: 'di ltar de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni /
translated: Because it is said:

original: gsal ba rig pa mkhas pas rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: gsal ba rig pa mkhas pas rtogs pa ste //
translated: It is known by the wise, the clear, the aware.

original: rang bzhin zhi ba 'gog min 'byung ba ma yin //üîΩzhes bya'o // de la gsal ba ni shes bya la ma rig pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhi ba 'gog min 'byung ba ma yin // zhes bya'o // de la gsal ba ni shes bya la ma rig pa med pa ste /
translated: It is not cessation, the natural peace, nor is it origination.üîΩHere, the clear are those who have no ignorance with regard to the knowable.

original: ma rig pa'i bag la nyal yod pa'i shes pa ni mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bag la nyal yod pa'i shes pa ni mi gsal ba'o //
translated: The consciousness in which the latent dispositions of ignorance exist is not clear.

original: rig pa mkhas pas rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: rig pa mkhas pas rtogs pa ste //
translated: The wise understand it.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag gis so so rang gi rig pas rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag gis so so rang gi rig pas rtogs pa ste /
translated: They understand it through their own understanding,

original: de dag la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises in dependence on them.

original: de la rig pa ni bden pa mthong ba rnams so //
analyzed: de la rig pa ni bden pa mthong ba rnams so //
translated: The wise are those who have seen the truths.

original: de dag nyid chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba mngon pa la mkhas pa ni mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba mngon pa la mkhas pa ni mkhas pa'o //
translated: They are wise because they are skilled in the Abhidharma and the Vinaya.

original: yang na gzhan dag de las thob nas brda la mkhas pa ni mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhan dag de las thob nas brda la mkhas pa ni mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Or else, others are wise when they have obtained it and are skilled in the conventional.

original: rang bzhin zhi ba ni rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhi ba ni rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: It is naturally peaceful, because it is naturally free of defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa la phyis nyon mongs pa med par gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa la phyis nyon mongs pa med par gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it becomes free of defilements later on, when it is associated with defilements.

original: 'gog min pa ni 'di ltar zhi ba gcig pu bgrod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog min pa ni 'di ltar zhi ba gcig pu bgrod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not cessation, because it is not a mere peace, since it is not a mere transcendence of the world.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba la lta ba dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba la lta ba dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not non-arising, because it is associated with the vision of the benefit of sentient beings.

original: 'byung ba ma yin pa ni 'khor ba las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba ma yin pa ni 'khor ba las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not an appearance, because it is beyond the cycle of birth and death.

original: de ltar ye shes de mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba la mi gnas pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ye shes de mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba la mi gnas pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, this intuition should be understood as not abiding in either nirvana or the life-cycle.

original: de ltar dmigs pa las byung ba phra ba nyid dang / gnas las byung ba phra ba nyid dang / rnam par dag pa phra ba nyid dang / yon tan phra ba nyid kyis kyang reg par dka' bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa las byung ba phra ba nyid dang / gnas las byung ba phra ba nyid dang / rnam par dag pa phra ba nyid dang / yon tan phra ba nyid kyis kyang reg par dka' bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is difficult to experience because of subtlety of objective, subtlety of basis, subtlety of purification, and subtlety of excellences.

original: de la phra ba nyid dang po ni 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa po rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la phra ba nyid dang po ni 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa po rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du rig bar bya'o //
translated: The first subtlety is to be understood as the non-commonality of the bodhisattva with mundane equipoised meditators.

original: gnyis pa dang gsum pa ni gzhan mu stegs can gyi gnas ston par khas 'che ba rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang gsum pa ni gzhan mu stegs can gyi gnas ston par khas 'che ba rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The second and third are the non-commonality of the bodhisattva with the tirthikas who claim to teach the stages of liberation.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The fourth is the non-commonality of the bodhisattva with the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa'i 'di'i phra ba nyid ni yan lag go /
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa'i 'di'i phra ba nyid ni yan lag go /
translated: Thus, the subtlety of this verse is its branch.

original: phra ba nyid rnam pa gnyis ni nye ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: phra ba nyid rnam pa gnyis ni nye ba'i yan lag go //
translated: The two kinds of subtlety are the proximate factors.

original: de yang shin tu reg par dka' ba nyid kyis rab tu phye ba thob pa'i dus na phra ba nyid ni yan lag go //
analyzed: de yang shin tu reg par dka' ba nyid kyis rab tu phye ba thob pa'i dus na phra ba nyid ni yan lag go //
translated: And that is the factor, since it is distinguished by being very difficult to attain.

original: lhag ma rnam pa bzhi ni nye ba'i yan lag tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnam pa bzhi ni nye ba'i yan lag tu rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining four kinds should be understood as the proximate factors.

original: de ltar ye shes phra ba gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes phra ba gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of that subtle intuition?

original: rang bzhin stong yod gnyis min zang mi shes //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong yod gnyis min zang mi shes //
translated: It is not empty by nature, nor is it dual, nor is it undifferentiated,

original: 'gro @124b las rnam grol mnyam brnyes mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: 'gro @124b las rnam grol mnyam brnyes mya ngan 'das //
translated: it is liberated from going and coming, it is equal, it is nirvana,

original: mtha' dang dbung min tshig gis brjod du med //üîΩdus gsum rnam las grol ba nam mkha' mnyam //
analyzed: mtha' dang dbung min tshig gis brjod du med // dus gsum rnam las grol ba nam mkha' mnyam //
translated: it is not an extreme or a middle, it is inexpressible by words,

original: zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: it is liberated from the three times, it is equal to space.

original: de la ye shes de'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la ye shes de'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The characteristics of that intuition should be understood as twofold:

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: the general characteristic and the particular characteristic.

original: de la ye shes de'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la ye shes de'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the general characteristic of that intuition?

original: rang bzhin stong zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The statement empty of intrinsic nature

original: ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis stong pa'o //
translated: means empty of the identity of consciousness.

original: de ji ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is that the general characteristic?

original: chos thams cad ni ji skad brjod pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ji skad brjod pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are empty of the intrinsic nature described above.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o zhes bstan pa ci ri bong gi rva bzhin du med do zhes de ltar gzung bar bya ba'am smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o zhes bstan pa ci ri bong gi rva bzhin du med do zhes de ltar gzung bar bya ba'am smras pa ma yin no //
translated: The statement empty of intrinsic nature should not be understood or said to mean nonexistent like the horn of a rabbit.

original: ci stong pa de las ye shes gzhan la de las kyang stong pa nyid gzhan no zhes de ltar gzung bar bya'am /
analyzed: ci stong pa de las ye shes gzhan la de las kyang stong pa nyid gzhan no zhes de ltar gzung bar bya'am /
translated: Should it be understood that emptiness is one thing and consciousness is another, and that emptiness is something other than that?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: No, it should not be understood in that way.

original: ci de'i rang bzhin de yod pa las de phyis 'gyur te zad pa 'gags pa zhes de ltar gzung bar bya'am /
analyzed: ci de'i rang bzhin de yod pa las de phyis 'gyur te zad pa 'gags pa zhes de ltar gzung bar bya'am /
translated: Should it be understood that emptiness is one thing and form is another, and that emptiness is something other than that?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: No, it should not be understood in that way.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Then how should it be understood?

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de ni yod pa dang gnyis su med pa dang zad mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de ni yod pa dang gnyis su med pa dang zad mi shes pa'o //
translated: The nature of emptiness is not existent, not nonexistent, not both, not not both, not one, not different, not something to be eliminated, not something to be attained, not something to be abandoned, not something to be adopted, not something to be understood, not something to be misunderstood, not something to be cultivated, and not something to be made manifest.

original: skur pa 'debs pa yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa dang / tha dad pa yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa dang / 'gyur ba yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa'o //

original: gang dag rab zhi gnyis min zad mi shes //

original: 'gro las rnam par grol zhes gsungs pa ste /

analyzed: des 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par grol bar ston to // ji ltar @125a * //

original: ci ye shes de'i rgyun gyi thog mas zag pa zad par byas pa zhig gam /

analyzed: de dang mi 'dra ba sangs rgyas kyi mkhyen pas mngon sum du yang dag par thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //

original: bstan pa de ltar med de /
analyzed: bstan pa de ltar med de /

original: yi ge med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge med pa'i phyir ro //

original: de bas na brjod par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de bas na brjod par bya bar mi nus so //

analyzed: 'di ltar rna ba'i rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba ma yin la /

analyzed: ji ltar bar snang gnas kyi bya yi rjes //

analyzed: mkhas pas brjod mi nus la mi mthong ba //
translated: cannot be seen,

translated: Just as it is not the case that the name, phrase, and syllable groups are not established as the basis of the name, phrase, and syllable groups, in the same way, the bodhisattva stages, which are included in the knowledge of realization, are not the reality of the literal meaning, and so cannot be expressed or heard.

original: ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /

original: sangs rgyas kyi mi 'jigs pa'i ye shes ni phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i las can te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mi 'jigs pa'i ye shes ni phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i las can te /
translated: The power of knowing the defilement, cleansing, and emergence of meditative absorptions, liberations, samƒÅdhis, and samƒÅpattis is the power of the TathƒÅgata, as stated in the sutra.

original: gang gi phyir mi 'jigs pa chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩsangs rgyas kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag sbyin pa'i las can te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi 'jigs pa chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o // sangs rgyas kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag sbyin pa'i las can te /
translated: The power of remembering past lives is the power of the TathƒÅgata, as stated in the sutra.üîΩThe power of knowing the passing away and rebirth of beings is the power of the TathƒÅgata, as stated in the sutra.üîΩThe power of knowing the cessation of contaminants is the power of the TathƒÅgata, as stated in the sutra.üîΩThe power of knowing the Dharma is the power of the TathƒÅgata, as stated in the sutra.üîΩThe power of knowing the path is the power of the TathƒÅgata, as stated in the sutra.üîΩThe power of knowing the various dhƒÅtus is the power of the TathƒÅgata, as stated in the sutra.

analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos mnyam pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The power of knowing the various inclinations of beings is the power of the TathƒÅgata, as stated in the sutra.üîΩThe power of knowing the superior and inferior faculties of beings is the power of the TathƒÅgata, as stated in the sutra.üîΩThe power of knowing the path that leads everywhere is the power of the TathƒÅgata, as stated in the sutra.üîΩThe power of knowing the various meditative absorptions, liberations, samƒÅdhis, and samƒÅpattis is the power of the T

original: sangs rgyas kyi yongs su bskyab pa'i ye shes ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi pa dag gis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yongs su bskyab pa'i ye shes ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi pa dag gis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i las can te /
translated: The Buddha's knowledge of protection has the function of maturing beings through the four means of unification.

original: gang gi phyir 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said, in order to protect all beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod ba'i ye shes ni de'i gzhi yongs su sbyong ba'i las can te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod ba'i ye shes ni de'i gzhi yongs su sbyong ba'i las can te /
translated: The Buddha's knowledge of conduct has the function of purifying the basis of that knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir snying brtse ba dang / snying rje chen po rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snying brtse ba dang / snying rje chen po rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said, in order to purify great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ma lus par mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la nyin mtshan lan drug tu rnam par gzigs pa'i las can te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ma lus par mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la nyin mtshan lan drug tu rnam par gzigs pa'i las can te /
translated: The Buddha's knowledge of all aspects has the function of viewing the world with the Buddha eye six times each day and night.

original: gang gi phyir phyogs bcu ma lus par shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs bcu ma lus par shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said, in order to attain knowledge of all the worlds.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yongs su sbyong ba'i ye shes ni ye shes dang sems thogs pa med pa'i phyir zhing thams cad du thogs pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sprul pa 'jug par byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yongs su sbyong ba'i ye shes ni ye shes dang sems thogs pa med pa'i phyir zhing thams cad du thogs pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sprul pa 'jug par byed pa'i las can te /
translated: The Buddha's purifying knowledge has the function of engaging in non-afflicted emanations, because it is unobstructed in all fields due to unobstructed knowledge and mind.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad la thogs pa med pa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad la thogs pa med pa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha's knowledge of what is to be purified has the function of engaging in afflicted emanations, because it is unobstructed in all Buddha-fields.

original: sangs rgyas kyis thugs su chud pa'i ye shes ni sems can de dag gi dus gsum gyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal skad cig gcig gis mkhyen pa'i las can te /üîΩgang gi phyir dus gsum skad cig gcig gis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis thugs su chud pa'i ye shes ni sems can de dag gi dus gsum gyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal skad cig gcig gis mkhyen pa'i las can te /üîΩgang gi phyir dus gsum skad cig gcig gis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha's knowledge of realization has the function of knowing in one instant the thoughts and latent tendencies of those sentient beings in the three times.üîΩThe Buddha's knowledge of the three times has the function of engaging in the three times without distinction, because it is unobstructed in the three times.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i ye shes ni 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgyar cig car du chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bas rnam par thar pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i las @130a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i ye shes ni 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgyar cig car du chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bas rnam par thar pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i las @130a * //
translated: The knowledge of turning the wheel of the Dharma of the Buddhas is the function of skill in the means of liberation, since it turns the wheel of the Dharma simultaneously in a billion Jambudvipas.

original: can te / gang gi phyir chos kyi 'khor lo chen po rab tu bskor ba la 'jigs pa med par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: can te / gang gi phyir chos kyi 'khor lo chen po rab tu bskor ba la 'jigs pa med par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: For what reason? In order to be fearless in turning the great wheel of the Dharma.

original: sems de skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i nang nas /
analyzed: sems de skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i nang nas /
translated: That thought arises refers to what was previously taught:

original: kye rgyal pa'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam 'di ni shin tu rnam par nges pa ste zhes gang 'byung ba de yin no //
analyzed: kye rgyal pa'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam 'di ni shin tu rnam par nges pa ste zhes gang 'byung ba de yin no //
translated: O sons of the Victorious Ones, this bodhisattva vow is extremely certain.

original: ci'i phyir de sems nyid la brjod kyi shes rab dang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan la ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de sems nyid la brjod kyi shes rab dang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan la ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it called thought, not wisdom or other mental factors?

original: sems la yongs su shes pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la yongs su shes pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because thought has four aspects such as complete knowledge and so on.

original: da ni gzhi gang las sems de skye bar 'gyur ba de ston te /
analyzed: da ni gzhi gang las sems de skye bar 'gyur ba de ston te /
translated: Now, the basis from which that mind arises is shown.

original: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba can dang / shes rab dang ye shes kyi dbang du gyur pa dang / thabs mkhas pas yongs su gzung ba dang / bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas rab tu bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba can dang / shes rab dang ye shes kyi dbang du gyur pa dang / thabs mkhas pas yongs su gzung ba dang / bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas rab tu bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: It is preceded by great compassion, is governed by wisdom and knowledge, is sustained by skillful means, is well-taught by intention and superior intention, and possesses the immeasurable power of the Tathagatas.

original: snying stobs kyi stobs dang / blo'i stobs kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rnam par 'byed pa dang / rang byung gi ye shes dang mthun pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shes rab dang / ye shes kyi gdams ngag yang dag par tshol ba dang /
analyzed: snying stobs kyi stobs dang / blo'i stobs kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rnam par 'byed pa dang / rang byung gi ye shes dang mthun pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shes rab dang / ye shes kyi gdams ngag yang dag par tshol ba dang /
translated: It is a discernment that is well-differentiated by the power of courage and the power of intellect, is in accord with self-arisen knowledge, and seeks the instructions of wisdom and knowledge regarding all Buddha-dharmas.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa dang / nam mkha'i khams ltar gnas shing phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes bya ba bcu pa 'dis ston to //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa dang / nam mkha'i khams ltar gnas shing phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes bya ba bcu pa 'dis ston to //
translated: It is taught by this tenth one called pervading the realm of phenomena, abiding like the space element, reaching the end of the far-reaching future.

original: de la snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po nyid rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po nyid rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: Great compassion is called preliminary because it is the cause of the other perfections.üîΩGreat mastery is the mastery of wisdom and intuition, because it is produced by the power of knowledge of the most subtle suffering.üîΩGreat retention is the retention of the Dharma teachings, because it is the cause of the retention of the Dharma teachings.üîΩGreat liberation is the liberation of the bodhisattva, because it is the cause of the liberation of the bodhisattva.

original: phra ba'i sdug bsngal nyid shes pa'i dbang gis skyes pa nyid kyi phyir dbang du gyur pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir shes rab dang ye shes kyi dbang du gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde la skabs 'dir shes rab ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba'i rnam pa yin /
analyzed: phra ba'i sdug bsngal nyid shes pa'i dbang gis skyes pa nyid kyi phyir dbang du gyur pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir shes rab dang ye shes kyi dbang du gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'o // de la skabs 'dir shes rab ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba'i rnam pa yin /
translated: Great intuition is the intuition of the bodhisattva, because it is the cause of the intuition of the bodhisattva.üîΩGreat intuition of liberation is the intuition of the Buddha, because it is the cause of the intuition of the Buddha.üîΩGreat intuition of all aspects is the intuition of the Buddha, because it is the cause of the intuition of the Buddha.

original: ye shes ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'jug pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rnam pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩsems can sdug bsngal ba yongs su bskyab pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yongs su zin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ye shes ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'jug pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rnam pa yin par rig par bya'o // sems can sdug bsngal ba yongs su bskyab pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yongs su zin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Great intuition of the ultimate is the intuition of the Buddha, because it is the cause of the intuition of the Buddha.üîΩGreat intuition of the conventional is the intuition of the bodhisattva, because it is the cause of the intuition of the bodhisattva.üîΩGreat intuition of the varieties is the intuition of the bodhisattva, because it is the cause of the intuition of the bodhisattva.üîΩGreat intuition of accomplishment is the intuition of the bodhisattva, because it is the cause of the intuition of the bodhisattva.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir thabs mkhas pas yongs su gzung zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir thabs mkhas pas yongs su gzung zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Great intuition of the ultimate is the intuition of the bodhisattva, because it is the cause of the intuition of the bodhisattva.üîΩGreat intuition of the conventional is the intuition of the bodhisattva, because it is the cause of the intuition of the bodhisattva.üîΩGreat intuition of the varieties is the intuition of the bodhisattva, because it is the cause of the intuition of the bodhisattva.üîΩGreat intuition of accomplishment is the intuition of the bodhisattva, because it is the cause of the intuition of the bodhisattva.üîΩGreat intuition of the ultimate is the intuition of the bodhisattva, because it is the cause of the intuition of the bodhisattva.üîΩGreat intuition of the conventional is the intuition of the bodhisattva, because it is the cause of the intuition of the bodhisattva.üîΩGreat intuition of the varieties is the intuition of the bodhisattva, because it is the cause of the intuition of the bodhisattva.

original: de'i dus dang 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don bya bar khas blangs pas 'phel ba nyid kyi phyir rab tu rton pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de'i dus dang 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don bya bar khas blangs pas 'phel ba nyid kyi phyir rab tu rton pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Since he has promised to work for the welfare of sentient beings for as long as they exist and for as long as cyclic existence lasts, he is greatly committed.

original: bsam pa dang lhag pa'i @130b bsam pas rab tu brtan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dang lhag pa'i @130b bsam pas rab tu brtan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He is greatly committed because of his intention and superior intention.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dpag tu med pa 'bras bur yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir dpag tu med pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dpag tu med pa 'bras bur yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir dpag tu med pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Since he has taken on the immeasurable powers of the tathagatas as his result, he is greatly immeasurable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩrgya chen po la mos pa dang zab mo shes pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o // rgya chen po la mos pa dang zab mo shes pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: He is greatly immeasurable because he possesses the immeasurable powers of the tathagatas.üîΩSince he is victorious over counteragents through his interest in the vast and his knowledge of the profound,

original: shin tu rnam par phye pa'i rnam par 'byed pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par phye pa'i rnam par 'byed pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: he is greatly analytical in his discernment.

original: snying stobs kyi stobs dang / blo'i stobs kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rnam par 'byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: snying stobs kyi stobs dang / blo'i stobs kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rnam par 'byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The power of courage and the power of mind are called the power of discernment.

original: rang gi mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir rjes su mthun pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir rjes su mthun pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The great conformity is because of being directed toward one's own complete enlightenment.

original: rang byung gi ye shes dang mthun pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang byung gi ye shes dang mthun pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that it is in conformity with self-arisen gnosis.

original: khyad par du 'gro ba'i man ngag yongs su tshol ba nyid kyi phyir yang dag par tshol ba chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba'i man ngag yongs su tshol ba nyid kyi phyir yang dag par tshol ba chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The great thorough search is because of seeking the instructions for progress.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shes rab dang ; ye shes kyi gdams ngag yang dag par tshol ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shes rab dang ; ye shes kyi gdams ngag yang dag par tshol ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that it thoroughly searches for the instructions of wisdom and gnosis in all the Buddha's teachings.

original: yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa gtso bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir dam pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa gtso bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir dam pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The great sacredness is because of being the foremost in holding the qualities.

original: chos kyi dbyings dam pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dam pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that it is endowed with the sacred dharmadhatu.

original: 'bras bu yid du 'ong pa'i rgyus zad mi shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir gnas pa dang mthar phyin pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu yid du 'ong pa'i rgyus zad mi shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir gnas pa dang mthar phyin pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Greatness of duration and consummation is due to the fact that the cause of a pleasant result is inexhaustible and that one is directed toward nirvana.

original: nam mkha'i khams ltar gnas shing phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ltar gnas shing phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that it lasts as long as the element of space and reaches the end of time.

original: da ni ci 'dra ba'i sems de skye bar 'gyur ba de ston to //
analyzed: da ni ci 'dra ba'i sems de skye bar 'gyur ba de ston to //
translated: Now it is shown what kind of thought that is which arises.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i sems de skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i sems de skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: This is the kind of thought that arises.

original: sems skye ba de skyes ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' so so'i skye bo las shin tu 'das pa yin /
analyzed: sems skye ba de skyes ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' so so'i skye bo las shin tu 'das pa yin /
translated: As soon as that thought arises, the bodhisattva has transcended the stage of ordinary beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs pa yin /
translated: He has entered into the faultless stage of the bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin /üîΩgnas brjod pas kha na ma thob med pa yin /üîΩ'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las phyir log pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin / gnas brjod pas kha na ma thob med pa yin / 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las phyir log pa yin /
translated: He has been born into the family of the Tathagatas.üîΩHe is free from the reproach of the world.üîΩHe has turned away from all worldly paths.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'gro bar zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'gro bar zhugs pa yin /
translated: He has entered the supramundane path.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa yin /
translated: He is established in the reality of the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la rab tu gnas pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la rab tu gnas pa yin /
translated: He is well-established in the bodhisattva stages.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yin /
translated: He has realized the equality of the three times.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges shing rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzhol ba yin @131a * //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges shing rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzhol ba yin @131a * // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He is destined to the lineage of the Tathagata and is intent on perfect enlightenment.

original: de la so so'i skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'das pa ni 'phags pa nyid de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob par ston to /
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'das pa ni 'phags pa nyid de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob par ston to /
translated: Therein, he has transcended the stage of ordinary beings, which shows that he has attained the supramundane path.

original: shin tu 'das pa de yang rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: shin tu 'das pa de yang rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
translated: That transcendence should be understood as eightfold:

original: mngal du zhugs pa dang 'dra bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang bor mngon par grub pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: mngal du zhugs pa dang 'dra bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang bor mngon par grub pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because he has already accomplished the first supramundane mind, which is like entering the womb,

original: zhugs pas shin tu 'das pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: zhugs pas shin tu 'das pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: he has transcended entry,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because he has entered the faultlessness of the bodhisattva.

original: rigs su skyes pa dang 'dra bas rigs kyis shin tu 'das pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rigs su skyes pa dang 'dra bas rigs kyis shin tu 'das pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Because it is like being born into the family, it is beyond family.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is born into the family of the Tathagatas.

analyzed: gnad brjod pas kha na ma thob pa med pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //

original: 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las phyir log pa yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las phyir log pa yin /

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'gro bar zhugs pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //

original: lus kyi rang bzhin dang mthun pas snying rje'i bdag nyid kyis gzhan gyi dgos pa bdag gi dgos pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir chos nyid kyis shin tu 'das pa ni gang gi phyir /

translated: Since he is in accord with the nature of the body, he is the embodiment of compassion, and the needs of others are his own needs.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //

translated: Since he is in accord with the way of life of the newborn, he does not abandon samsara, and he abides in the skill in means that is free of defilement.

translated: The recollection of the Buddha from the bodhisattvas is because of the words ‚Äúthe bodhisattvas. ‚ÄùüîΩThe recollection of the Buddha from their practice is because of the words ‚Äúthe practices of the bodhisattvas. ‚Äù

translated: The recollection of the Buddha from their vow is because of the words ‚Äúthe vows of the bodhisattvas. ‚ÄùüîΩThe recollection of the Buddha from their purification is because of the words ‚Äúthe purification of the Buddhafield. ‚ÄùüîΩThe recollection of the Buddha from their attainment is because of the words ‚Äúthe attainment of perfect enlightenment. ‚ÄùüîΩThe recollection of the Buddha from their turning of the wheel is because of the words ‚Äúthe turning of the wheel of the Dharma. ‚ÄùüîΩThe recollection of the Buddha from their great extinction is because of the words ‚Äúthe demonstration of final liberation. ‚Äù

original: rnam par dag pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Recollection of the Buddha from the point of view of his purity is as follows.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩkhyad par can nyid las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa zhes gsungs pa'o // khyad par can nyid las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni gang gi phyir /

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩmi 'phrogs pa nyid las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni gang gi phyir /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mi 'phrogs pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o // gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Recollection of the Buddha in terms of invincibility is because of the bodhisattvas invincibility.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩyang dag par thob par byed pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni gang gi phyir /

analyzed: sems can gyi don yang dag par thob par byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Recollection of the Buddha in terms of attainment is because of the attainment of the aims of self and others.

original: 'jug pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni gang gi phyir /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba @133a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba @133a * //

original: rjes su dran zhing mchog tu dga' ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran zhing mchog tu dga' ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //

original: de la rjes su dran pa dang po dang lhan cig pa'i dran pa gnyis ni sangs rgyas dang chos la ste /
analyzed: de la rjes su dran pa dang po dang lhan cig pa'i dran pa gnyis ni sangs rgyas dang chos la ste /

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni de 'dra ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni de 'dra ste /

original: bdag kyang de 'dra bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang de 'dra bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄúI will become like that,‚Äù is the recollection of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang rjes su dran pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang rjes su dran pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The recollection of the Buddha‚Äôs Dharma is because of the recollection of the Buddha‚Äôs Dharma.

original: gnyis ni de'i rigs la ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni de'i rigs la ste /
translated: The next two are of its lineage.

original: byang chub sems dpa' las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The recollection of the Buddha from the bodhisattva is because of the recollection of the bodhisattva.

original: spyod pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyod pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mindfulness of Buddha as practice is the mindfulness of the practice of the bodhisattva.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is in that order.

original: lhag ma rnam par dag pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnam par dag pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //

original: khyad par can nyid las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par can nyid las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mindfulness of Buddha as distinction is the mindfulness of the distinction of the bodhisattva stages.

original: mi 'phrogs pa nyid las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi 'phrogs pa nyid rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgdams ngag rjes su bstan pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa nyid las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi 'phrogs pa nyid rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro // gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni /
translated: The mindfulness of Buddha as inexhaustibility is the mindfulness of the inexhaustibility of the bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yang dag par thob par byed pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni sems can gyi don yang dag par thob par byed pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The recollection of the Buddha as the cause of attainment is the recollection of the attainment of the aims of beings.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as engagement is the recollection of the engagement of the Tathagata's intuition.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as differentiation is the recollection of the differentiation of the Buddha's qualities.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as the cause of attainment is the recollection of the attainment of the aims of beings.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as engagement is the recollection of the engagement of the Tathagata's intuition.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as differentiation is the recollection of the differentiation of the Buddha's qualities.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as the cause of attainment is the recollection of the attainment of the aims of beings.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as engagement is the recollection of the engagement of the Tathagata's intuition.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as differentiation is the recollection of the differentiation of the Buddha's qualities.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as the cause of attainment is the recollection of the attainment of the aims of beings.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as engagement is the recollection of the engagement of the Tathagata's intuition.

original: 'jug pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes las 'jug pa'i sbyor ba rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrab tu phye ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes las 'jug pa'i sbyor ba rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro // rab tu phye ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: The recollection of the Buddha as differentiation is the recollection of the differentiation of the Buddha's qualities.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as the cause of attainment is the recollection of the attainment of the aims of beings.

original: ji lta bus rab tu phye ba de ni rjes su dran pa rnams su rig par bya'o //üîΩgang gis rab tu phye zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bus rab tu phye ba de ni rjes su dran pa rnams su rig par bya'o // gang gis rab tu phye zhe na /
translated: The recollection of the Buddha as engagement is the recollection of the engagement of the Tathagata's intuition.

original: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: The recollection of the Buddha as differentiation is the recollection of the differentiation of the Buddha's qualities.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as the cause of attainment is the recollection of the attainment of the aims of beings.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as engagement is the recollection of the engagement of the Tathagata's intuition.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as differentiation is the recollection of the differentiation of the Buddha's qualities.üîΩThe recollection of the Buddha as the cause of attainment is the recollection of the attainment of the aims of beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de ji ltar rab tu phye zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de ji ltar rab tu phye zhe na /
translated: The recollection of the Buddha as engagement is the recollection of the engagement of the Tathagata's

original: sa'i khyad par du 'gro ba dang / sa'i mthar phyin par 'gro ba dang ; de la gdams ngag ma lus par rnyed pa dang / 'bras bur yod par sems can gyi don la sbyor ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug pa'i sbyor bas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: sa'i khyad par du 'gro ba dang / sa'i mthar phyin par 'gro ba dang ; de la gdams ngag ma lus par rnyed pa dang / 'bras bur yod par sems can gyi don la sbyor ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug pa'i sbyor bas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: the distinction of the stages, the culmination of the stages, the acquisition of the entire instruction, the application to the benefit of sentient beings in the state of result, and the distinction of the entry into the stage of the Tathagata.

original: 'dir yang spyod pa la sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni yan lag dang / nye ba'i yan lag tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang spyod pa la sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni yan lag dang / nye ba'i yan lag tu rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the recollection of the Buddha in the practice should be understood as the branches and the minor branches.

original: de'i 'og @133b tu de ltar byung ba na thob pa'i dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas phyir zhing mchog tu dga' ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og @133b tu de ltar byung ba na thob pa'i dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas phyir zhing mchog tu dga' ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: After that, when it has arisen in that way, he is again endowed with supreme joy, from the point of view of the attainment of the object.

original: bdag ni so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi yul las phyir log go zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag ni so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi yul las phyir log go zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: He says: I have turned away from the domain of all ordinary men.

original: so so'i skye bo longs spyod las phyir log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo longs spyod las phyir log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He has turned away from the enjoyment of ordinary men.

original: phyir log pa de yang rnam pa dgu ste ;
analyzed: phyir log pa de yang rnam pa dgu ste ;
translated: That turning away is ninefold:

original: 'jug pas phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pas phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: turning away from engagement, because

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas dang nye ba la zhugs so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas dang nye ba la zhugs so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: I have entered into proximity with the Buddhas.

original: ring ba'i dngos pos phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ring ba'i dngos pos phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: He turns back from the state of distance, because he says:

analyzed: bdag ni byis pa so so'i skye bo'i sa las ring du gyur to zhes gsungs pa'o //
