original: nye ba'i dngos pos phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: nye ba'i dngos pos phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: He turns back from the state of proximity, because he says:

original: bdag ni ye shes kyis dang nye bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni ye shes kyis dang nye bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: I am close to the knowledge of the Buddhas.

original: rgyun chad pas phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rgyun chad pas phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: He turns back from the state of continuity, because he says:

original: bdag ni ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba thams cad kyi rgyun chad pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba thams cad kyi rgyun chad pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: I have cut off the continuity of all bad destinies and bad rebirths.

original: ston pas phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ston pas phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: He turns back from the state of teacher, because he says:

original: bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi ston par gyur to zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi ston par gyur to zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: I have become a teacher for all sentient beings.

original: mthong ba dang nye bas phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba dang nye bas phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: He turns back from the state of proximity of seeing, because he says:

original: bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ngang nye bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ngang nye bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: I am close to seeing the Tathagata.

original: 'byung bas phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'byung bas phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The reason for returning is as follows.

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi yul la yang byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩmnyam pa nyid kyi phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi yul la yang byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'o // mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The return by emergence is because it is said, I have emerged in the domain of the Buddha.

original: bdag gi byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid dang ldan par gyur to zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩbral bas phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: bdag gi byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid dang ldan par gyur to zhes gsungs pa'o // bral bas phyir log pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The return by equality is because it is said, I have become endowed with the equality of all Bodhisattvas.

original: bdag ni 'jigs pa dang / bag tsha ba dang bral lo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni 'jigs pa dang / bag tsha ba dang bral lo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The return by separation is because it is said, I am separated from fear and anxiety.

original: de la gcig ste 'jug pas phyir log ba ni longs spyod mi 'dra bas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: de la gcig ste 'jug pas phyir log ba ni longs spyod mi 'dra bas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: Among these, the return by entry is distinguished by the different enjoyments.

original: gnyis te ring ba'i dngos pos phyir log pa dang / nye ba'i dngos pos phyir log pa ni lus mi 'dra bar rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis te ring ba'i dngos pos phyir log pa dang / nye ba'i dngos pos phyir log pa ni lus mi 'dra bar rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: The return by the thing far away and the return by the thing near are distinguished by the different bodies.

original: lhag ma drug po rgyun chad pas phyir log pa dang / ston pas phyir log pa dang / mthong ba dang nye bas phyir log pa dang / 'byung bas phyir log pa dang / mnyam pa nyid kyis phyir log pa dang / bral bas phyir log pa ni sgrub pa mi 'dra ba nyid dang /üîΩgcig gi grogs su gcig gyur pa'i dngos po mi 'dra ba nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa mi 'dra ba nyid dang / yul mi 'dra ba nyid dang / 'tsho ba mi 'dra ba nyid dang / phun @134a * //
analyzed: lhag ma drug po rgyun chad pas phyir log pa dang / ston pas phyir log pa dang / mthong ba dang nye bas phyir log pa dang / 'byung bas phyir log pa dang / mnyam pa nyid kyis phyir log pa dang / bral bas phyir log pa ni sgrub pa mi 'dra ba nyid dang / gcig gi grogs su gcig gyur pa'i dngos po mi 'dra ba nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa mi 'dra ba nyid dang / yul mi 'dra ba nyid dang / 'tsho ba mi 'dra ba nyid dang / phun @134a * //
translated: The remaining six are the reversal of the remaining six perfections, which are interrupted.üîΩThey are distinguished by the difference of practice, the difference of the nature of being a companion to one another, the difference of being under the influence of another, the difference of object, the difference of livelihood, and the difference of excellence.

original: sum tshogs pa mi 'dra ba nyid kyis rab tu phye ba ste /üîΩgo rims bzhin no //
analyzed: sum tshogs pa mi 'dra ba nyid kyis rab tu phye ba ste / go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are distinguished by the difference of fear, the difference of joy, the difference of delight, the difference of satisfaction, and the difference of happiness.

original: de la 'jigs pa ni mi 'dod par ltung du dogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'jigs pa ni mi 'dod par ltung du dogs pa ste /
translated: Fear is the apprehension of falling into what is undesirable.

original: sems pa yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: It is associated with mental dissatisfaction.üîΩJoy is the delight in virtue already achieved.

original: de yang sems dang lus 'gyur bar byed pa'i bye brag gis dngang ba dang bag tsha ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sems dang lus 'gyur bar byed pa'i bye brag gis dngang ba dang bag tsha ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, because of the particularities of the mind and body, it is called ‚Äúfear‚Äù and ‚Äútimidity.‚Äù

original: de'i 'og tu 'jigs pa de dag gang yin pa dang / ji ltar de gzhi dang bral ba dang med pa de ston te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'jigs pa de dag gang yin pa dang / ji ltar de gzhi dang bral ba dang med pa de ston te /
translated: After that, it shows how those fears are groundless and nonexistent.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba 'di thob ma thag tu 'jigs pa gang dag yin pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba 'di thob ma thag tu 'jigs pa gang dag yin pa 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúO sons of the Victorious Ones, as soon as the bodhisattvas attain this bodhisattva ground, Joyful, all the fears that they may have‚Äî

original: 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs pa'am /
analyzed: 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs pa'am /
translated: fears of not having a livelihood,

original: tshigs su bcad pa med pas 'jigs pa'am /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa med pas 'jigs pa'am /
translated: fears of not having praise,

original: 'chi bas 'jigs pa'am /
analyzed: 'chi bas 'jigs pa'am /
translated: fears of death,

original: ngan 'gros 'jigs pa'am /
analyzed: ngan 'gros 'jigs pa'am /
translated: fears of the lower realms,

original: 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha bas 'jigs pa de dag thams cad de la med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha bas 'jigs pa de dag thams cad de la med pa yin no //
translated: and fears of timidity in the midst of an assembly‚Äîall of these are gone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni bdag gi 'du shes dang bral bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni bdag gi 'du shes dang bral bas /
translated: Because they are free from the notion of self.

original: bdag phongs par sems pa yang med na /
analyzed: bdag phongs par sems pa yang med na /
translated: Since they do not think of themselves as being in need,

original: yo byad thams cad la phongs par sems pa lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: yo byad thams cad la phongs par sems pa lta ga la yod de /
translated: How could he be concerned about the lack of any possessions?

analyzed: de'i phyir de la 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he has no fear of lack of livelihood.

analyzed: de ni su las kyang rim gror bya ba cung zad tsam yang re ba med kyi /
translated: He does not expect even the slightest service from anyone.

analyzed: gzhan du na bdag nyid kyis sems can de dag la yo byad mang po thams cad kyis bsdu bar bya'o snyam du sems te /
translated: Rather, he thinks, ‚ÄúI myself will gather together all the many possessions of those sentient beings.‚Äù

analyzed: de'i phyir de la tshigs su bcad pa med pas 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he has no fear of lack of praise.

original: de bdag tu lta ba dang bral bas bdag gi 'du shes med de /
analyzed: de bdag tu lta ba dang bral bas bdag gi 'du shes med de /
translated: He is free from the view of self and has no notion of self.

original: de'i phyir de la 'chi bas 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la 'chi bas 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he has no fear of death.

original: bdag shi nas kyang gdon mi za bar sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dag dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag shi nas kyang gdon mi za bar sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dag dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAfter my death, I will certainly not be separated from the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de la ngan 'gros 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la ngan 'gros 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he has no fear of the lower realms.

original: bdag gi bsam pa dang mtshungs pa yang 'jig rten na su yang med na /
analyzed: bdag gi bsam pa dang mtshungs pa yang 'jig rten na su yang med na /
translated: There is no one in the world who has the same thoughts as I do.üîΩ

original: ches lhag par ltag la yod snyam ste /
analyzed: ches lhag par ltag la yod snyam ste /
translated: No one in the world is equal to me in intelligence, much less superior.

original: de'i phyir de la 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa med pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa med pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, he has no fear of being reproached in the assembly.

original: 'di dag ni sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir dang / sa'i legs pa'i khyad par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir dang / sa'i legs pa'i khyad par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These are the resistances to the stages and the excellences of the stages.

original: 'jigs pa de dag las dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / tha ma dang / gsum ni lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyis myong ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: 'jigs pa de dag las dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / tha ma dang / gsum ni lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyis myong ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: The first, second, and last of these fears are based on the body, speech, and mind.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa bde 'gro @134b dang ngan 'gro'i lus dang 'bral ba dang / 'phrad pa'i gnas yin pas lus kyi gnas te /
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa bde 'gro @134b dang ngan 'gro'i lus dang 'bral ba dang / 'phrad pa'i gnas yin pas lus kyi gnas te /
translated: The third and fourth are based on the body, since they are the acquisition and non-acquisition of a body in good or evil states of existence.

original: de'i phyir lnga kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lnga kho na'o //
translated: Thus, there are just five fears.

original: brdeg pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa rnams kyang 'di dag gi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdeg pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa rnams kyang 'di dag gi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fears of being beaten, bound, and so on are included in these five.

original: 'jigs pa'i gzhi ni mdor bsdu na gnyis su bstan te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i gzhi ni mdor bsdu na gnyis su bstan te /
translated: The basis of fear is taught in brief as twofold:

original: leg pa'i shes bya la mngon par zhen pa'i 'du shes dang / lta ba dang / sred pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba nyid de /
analyzed: leg pa'i shes bya la mngon par zhen pa'i 'du shes dang / lta ba dang / sred pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba nyid de /
translated: the characteristic of strong attachment to the perception, view, and craving of the knowable, and the smallness of the roots of virtue.

original: de'i gnyen po ni 'di ltar de ni bdag gi 'du shes dang bral bas /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni 'di ltar de ni bdag gi 'du shes dang bral bas /
translated: The antidote to that is as follows: Since they are free from the perception of self,

original: bdag la phangs par sems pa yang med na /
analyzed: bdag la phangs par sems pa yang med na /
translated: they do not think of themselves as precious.üîΩSince they do not think of themselves as precious, how could they think of all possessions as precious?

original: yo byad thams cad la phangs par sems pa lta ba la yod ces bya ba dang / de ni su las kyang rim gror bya ba cung zad tsam yang re ba med kyi /
analyzed: yo byad thams cad la phangs par sems pa lta ba la yod ces bya ba dang / de ni su las kyang rim gror bya ba cung zad tsam yang re ba med kyi /
translated: They do not expect even the slightest service from anyone.üîΩRather, they think, ‚ÄúI myself will gather all the many possessions for those sentient beings.‚Äù

original: gzhan du na bdag nyid kyis sems can de dag la yo byang mang po thams cad kyis sdud par bya'o snyam du sems zhes bya ba dang / de bdag tu lta ba dang bral bas bdag gi 'du shes med ces bya ba dang / bdag shi nas kyang gdon mi za bar sangs rgyas dang /
analyzed: gzhan du na bdag nyid kyis sems can de dag la yo byang mang po thams cad kyis sdud par bya'o snyam du sems zhes bya ba dang / de bdag tu lta ba dang bral bas bdag gi 'du shes med ces bya ba dang / bdag shi nas kyang gdon mi za bar sangs rgyas dang /
translated: Since they are free from the view of self, they do not have the perception of self.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag dang mi bral bar 'gyur snyam zhes bya ba dang bdag gi bsam pa dang mtshungs pa yang 'jig rten na su yang med na /üîΩches lhag pa lta ga la yod snyam zhes bya ba'o //üîΩkye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar 'jigs pa dang / dngang ba dang / bag tsha pa dang / spu zing zhes byad pa med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa nyams pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag dang mi bral bar 'gyur snyam zhes bya ba dang bdag gi bsam pa dang mtshungs pa yang 'jig rten na su yang med na / ches lhag pa lta ga la yod snyam zhes bya ba'o // kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar 'jigs pa dang / dngang ba dang / bag tsha pa dang / spu zing zhes byad pa med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa nyams pa dang /
translated: There is no one in the world equal to me in intention, much less superior.üîΩO sons of the victors, the bodhisattva who is thus free from fear, terror, and trembling, because of the preeminence of great compassion, applies himself to the non-degeneration and non-lowliness of superior intention, and to the complete gathering of all roots of virtue.

original: mi dma' bas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir rab tu sbyor bar byed de zhes bya ba la de ltar 'jigs pa dang / dngang ba dang / bag cha ba dang / spu zing zhes byed pa med ces bya bas ni sngar 'jigs pa bstan pa nyid kyi lus 'byung ba'i bye brag can ston to //
analyzed: mi dma' bas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir rab tu sbyor bar byed de zhes bya ba la de ltar 'jigs pa dang / dngang ba dang / bag cha ba dang / spu zing zhes byed pa med ces bya bas ni sngar 'jigs pa bstan pa nyid kyi lus 'byung ba'i bye brag can ston to //
translated: By thus free from fear, terror, and trembling, he shows the absence of fear that was previously taught, and the specific emergence of the body.

original: ma nyams pa dang mi nyams zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nyams pa dang mi nyams zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase not corrupted and not corruptible means that it is not mixed with afflictions and with the mental activity of the Disciple and Rhinoceros vehicles.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang dag sa des bsdus pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang dag sa des bsdus pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase in order to gather all the roots of virtue means that it gathers all the roots of virtue that are included in that stage.

original: sbyor bar byed pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the application of that?

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis te /
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis te /
translated: It is the perfection of the three: the perfection of aspiration, the perfection of application, and the perfection of dedication.

original: de ni bcu pa gsum gyis ston to //
analyzed: de ni bcu pa gsum gyis ston to //
translated: This is taught by the three in the tenth verse.

original: dad pa'i dbang gi phyir dang / dang @135a * //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang gi phyir dang / dang @135a * //
translated: The phrase through the power of faith means that it is the cause of the perfection of aspiration.

original: ba mang ba'i phyir dang / mos pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / srid par 'dzin pa mang ba'i phyir dang / snying brtse ba dang / snying rje mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / byams pa chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / yid yongs su mi skyo ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: ba mang ba'i phyir dang / mos pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / srid par 'dzin pa mang ba'i phyir dang / snying brtse ba dang / snying rje mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / byams pa chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / yid yongs su mi skyo ba'i phyir dang /
translated: because of the abundance of compassion, because of the purity of aspiration, because of the abundance of grasping at existence, because of the accomplishment of love and compassion, because of the possession of great love, because of the absence of mental fatigue,üîΩbecause of the ornament of shame and embarrassment, because of the possession of patience and mildness, and because of the abundance of respect and service to the teaching of the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Accomplished Buddha.

original: ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa'i rgyan gyi phyir dang / bzod cing des pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la gus shing rim gro byed pa mang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba bcu pa 'dis ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa'i rgyan gyi phyir dang / bzod cing des pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la gus shing rim gro byed pa mang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba bcu pa 'dis ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
translated: This tenth shows the perfection of attitude.

original: de la dngos po gang dag la dad pa de dbang du byed pa de'i bye brag gis dbang de rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po gang dag la dad pa de dbang du byed pa de'i bye brag gis dbang de rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /

original: dkon mchog gsum po dag la dang ba'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir dang ba mang ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩbdag gis rtogs pa la rnam par dag pa'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum po dag la dang ba'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir dang ba mang ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o // bdag gis rtogs pa la rnam par dag pa'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The power of faith of clear faith in the Three Jewels is because of the abundance of clarity.

original: mos pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The power of faith of pure faith in one's own understanding is because of the purity of conviction.

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pa la srid par 'dzin pa'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir srid par 'dzin pa mang ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩsems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir brtse ba dang / snying rje'i dad pa'i dbang dang / byams pa'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pa la srid par 'dzin pa'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir srid par 'dzin pa mang ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o // sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir brtse ba dang / snying rje'i dad pa'i dbang dang / byams pa'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The power of faith of faith in the understanding of others is because of the abundance of faith in existence.

original: snying brtse ba dang / snying rje mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / byams pa chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: snying brtse ba dang / snying rje mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / byams pa chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The power of faith of compassion and love for the sake of developing living beings is because of the accomplishment of compassion and love and because of the possession of great love.

original: snying brtse ba dang / snying rje ni sdug bsngal sel ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: snying brtse ba dang / snying rje ni sdug bsngal sel ba'i rnam pa yin no //

analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa ni phyir zhing mngon sum du byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: And the accomplishment of that is the repeated actualization of it.

original: byams pa ni bdag gis de dag bskyab bo snyam pa'i rnam pa de lta bu yin no ;
analyzed: byams pa ni bdag gis de dag bskyab bo snyam pa'i rnam pa de lta bu yin no ;

original: ser sna la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos la 'dzem pas chu gang dang ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir /üîΩngo tsha shes shing khrel yong ba'i rgyan gyi phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos la 'dzem pas chu gang dang ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir /üîΩngo tsha shes shing khrel yong ba'i rgyan gyi phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The power of faith that is not discouraged is because of the acceptance of samsara for a long time, in many lifetimes, in

original: chos mthun pa la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pas des pa'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir bzod @135b cing des pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos mthun pa la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pas des pa'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir bzod @135b cing des pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He does not harm those who are in accord with the Dharma. The power of faith of the one who is gentle is because of his patience and gentleness.

original: de la bsti stang byed pas bstan pa la gus pa'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de la bsti stang byed pas bstan pa la gus pa'i dad pa'i dbang ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The power of faith of the one who is respectful is because of his respect for the teaching.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bstan pa la gus shing rim gro byed pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bstan pa la gus shing rim gro byed pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The power of faith of the one who is devoted is because of his devotion to the teaching of the Tathagata, the Saint, the perfectly enlightened Buddha.

original: tha ma'i gsum pos ni gang gis te pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / gang dag gis te grogs dag dang / gang la ste bstan pa la rab tu sbyor ba de yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: tha ma'i gsum pos ni gang gis te pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / gang dag gis te grogs dag dang / gang la ste bstan pa la rab tu sbyor ba de yongs su bstan to //
translated: The last three powers show by whom, by means of what, and where one applies oneself.

original: de lta bu re zhig bsam pa phun sum tshogs pas brtson par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu re zhig bsam pa phun sum tshogs pas brtson par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, one who is endowed with the perfection of aspiration applies himself.

original: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of application?

original: nyin mtshan du dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs pas mi ngoms pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i phyir dang / chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba'i phyir dang / mang du thos pa tshol bas ngoms mi myong ba'i phyir dang / ji skad thos pa'i chos la tshul bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: nyin mtshan du dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs pas mi ngoms pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i phyir dang / chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba'i phyir dang / mang du thos pa tshol bas ngoms mi myong ba'i phyir dang / ji skad thos pa'i chos la tshul bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because of being insatiable in accumulating roots of virtue and so on, day and night; because of relying on spiritual masters; because of delighting in the joy of the Dharma; because of being insatiable in seeking much learning; because of properly realizing the Dharma as it is heard;

original: yid gnas med pa'i phyir dang / rnyed pa dang ; bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la chags pa med pa'i phyir dang / yo byad la phangs par sems shing mngon par dga' ba med pa'i phyir dang / sems bskyed pa rin po che lta bu ngoms pa med par mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
analyzed: yid gnas med pa'i phyir dang / rnyed pa dang ; bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la chags pa med pa'i phyir dang / yo byad la phangs par sems shing mngon par dga' ba med pa'i phyir dang / sems bskyed pa rin po che lta bu ngoms pa med par mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
translated: because of the mind being unfixed; because of being unattached to gain, honor, and praise; because of not cherishing and delighting in possessions; and because of accomplishing the precious mind of enlightenment without satiation. This shows the perfection of application.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs pa la rgyun mi 'chad par mngon par brtson pa nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs pa la rgyun mi 'chad par mngon par brtson pa nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The uninterrupted striving in accumulating roots of virtue and so on is because of the following.

original: nyin mtshan du dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs pas mi ngoms pa'i zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyin mtshan du dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs pas mi ngoms pa'i zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and by the accumulation of roots of virtue and so on, he is never satisfied.

original: sogs pa de yang rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa de yang rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
translated: And that and so on is to be known as eightfold.

original: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bsnyen bkur byed pa la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bsnyen bkur byed pa la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: In order that it not be lost, he serves and so on, because

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brtan pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde nas 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa'i dga' bas chos kyi kun dga' ba sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brtan pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o // de nas 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa'i dga' bas chos kyi kun dga' ba sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: he is steadfast in the spiritual friend.

original: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩmang du thos pa la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o // mang du thos pa la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Then, he delights in the Dharma, because he is delighted by the confirmation of the discourse on the connection.üîΩHe is insatiable in his quest for much learning, because

original: mang du thos pa tshol ba la ngoms mi myong ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mang du thos pa tshol ba la ngoms mi myong ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: he is insatiable in his quest for much learning.

original: rtog pa la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: He is endowed with reflection and so on, because

original: ji skad thos pa'i chos la tshul bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad thos pa'i chos la tshul bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: he properly reflects on the Dharma as he has heard it.

original: gnas med pa la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gnas med pa la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: He is without abode and so on, becauseüîΩhe is without abode in the world.

original: yid gnas med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩmang du thos pa la sogs pa gsu @136a * //
analyzed: yid gnas med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o // mang du thos pa la sogs pa gsu @136a * //
translated: because the mind has no abode.

original: bshad ma thag pa gsum po de dag ni thos pa dang / bsam pa dang bsgom pa rnams dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa gsum po de dag ni thos pa dang / bsam pa dang bsgom pa rnams dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The three just explained are, respectively, learning, reflection, and meditation.

original: gnas med pa ni 'dir bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas med pa ni 'dir bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the absence of an abode should be understood as the absence of relishing meditative absorption.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rnams la bar du gcod pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rnams la bar du gcod pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to avoid obstacles to the bodhisattva‚Äôs training,üîΩthe bodhisattva should avoid excessive attachment to gain and honor, and should avoid excessive delight in gain and honor.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti thob pa dang / ma thob pa la lhag par chags pa med pa sogs pa dang / mngon par dga' ba med pa sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /üîΩrnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la chags pa med pa'i phyir dang / yo byad la phangs par sems shing mngon par dga' ba med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti thob pa dang / ma thob pa la lhag par chags pa med pa sogs pa dang / mngon par dga' ba med pa sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /üîΩrnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la chags pa med pa'i phyir dang / yo byad la phangs par sems shing mngon par dga' ba med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he is not attached to gain, honor, or fame, and because he does not think of or delight in possessions.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems rgyun mi 'chad par mngon du byed pas rin po che lta bu'i sems sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems rgyun mi 'chad par mngon du byed pas rin po che lta bu'i sems sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The precious mind is the uninterrupted manifestation of the supramundane mind.

original: sems bskyed pa rin po che lta bu ngoms pa med par mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa rin po che lta bu ngoms pa med par mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Because of the precious mind, one accomplishes the generation of the mind without satiation.

original: de lta bu ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pas brtson par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pas brtson par byed pa'o //
translated: Such is the practice of striving with perfect application.

original: yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pas brtson par byed pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pas brtson par byed pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the practice of striving with perfect dedication?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dag la lhag par dmigs ba'i phyir dang / pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa yongs su tshol ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dag la lhag par dmigs ba'i phyir dang / pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa yongs su tshol ba'i phyir dang /
translated: Because of the desire for the stage of omniscience, because of the special focus on the powers, fearlessnesses, and unique qualities of the Tathagata, because of the pursuit of the unattached perfections,

original: sgyu dang g-yo yongs su spangs pa'i phyir dang / ji skad smras pa de ltar byed pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bden pa'i tshig lhur len pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sun par mi byed pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo yongs su spangs pa'i phyir dang / ji skad smras pa de ltar byed pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bden pa'i tshig lhur len pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sun par mi byed pa'i phyir dang /
translated: It is because they have completely abandoned deceit and hypocrisy, because they do as they say, because they always take delight in truthful speech, and because they do not offend the family of the tathagatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab ba mi gtong ba dang / ri'i dbang po'i rgyal po ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems mi g-yos ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i bya ba thams cad kyang mi 'dod la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab ba mi gtong ba dang / ri'i dbang po'i rgyal po ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems mi g-yos ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i bya ba thams cad kyang mi 'dod la /
translated: It is because they do not abandon the training of the bodhisattvas and because, like the king of mountains, their omniscient mind is unshaken.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang yang ldan pa'i phyir dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs sogs pa la chog mi shes pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa yongs su tshol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang yang ldan pa'i phyir dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs sogs pa la chog mi shes pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa yongs su tshol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
translated: This shows the perfection of dedication, because he is endowed with the supramundane path, because he is insatiable in accumulating the factors of enlightenment, and because he is always seeking higher and higher distinctions without interruption.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa @136b mngon par 'dod pa ni yan lag go //
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa @136b mngon par 'dod pa ni yan lag go //
translated: The stage of omniscience is the member.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs la dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / rnam par dag pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / yongs su spong bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs la dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / rnam par dag pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / yongs su spong bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang /
translated: The stage of omniscience is desired through the observation of the powers of the Tathagata, through the desire for the stage of omniscience by means of purification, through the desire for the stage of omniscience by means of complete abandonment,

original: ji skad smras pa de ltar byed pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / rjes su srung bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / rigs sun bar mi byed pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de ltar byed pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / rjes su srung bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / rigs sun bar mi byed pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang /
translated: The desire for the stage of omniscience through being just as one speaks, through guarding, through not disappointing one's family,

original: mi gtong bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / mi g-yos pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / mi 'dor la ldan pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / sogs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: mi gtong bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / mi g-yos pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / mi 'dor la ldan pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / sogs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang /
translated: through not giving up, through not wavering, through not rejecting and through possessing, and so on,

original: yongs su tshol bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod ba ni nye ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: yongs su tshol bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod ba ni nye ba'i yan lag go //
translated: the desire for the stage of omniscience through investigation, is the proximate factor of stabilization.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa ni gang mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa ni gang mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Therein, the desire for the stage of omniscience is the desire for that which is to be attained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la lhag par dmigs pa ci 'dra ba mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la lhag par dmigs pa ci 'dra ba mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of aim are the aim of the knowledge of all the aspects, the aim of the knowledge of paths, and the aim of the knowledge of the bases of the discrimination of all things.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa yongs su tshol ba ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa yongs su tshol ba ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The aim of the unattached perfections is just as one wishes.

original: de dag la brten nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa gsum rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la brten nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa gsum rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the three aims are based on those three aims, the aim of the knowledge of all the aspects, etc.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa yongs su tshol ba ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa yongs su tshol ba ste /
translated: The aim of the unattached perfections is just as one wishes.

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa de'i rab tu dbye ba la brten nas mngon par 'dod pa gzhan rnams rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa de'i rab tu dbye ba la brten nas mngon par 'dod pa gzhan rnams rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the other aims are based on the classification of that aim.

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ma ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ma ni gnyis te /
translated: The stain of the perfection of giving is twofold:

original: sgyu dang g-yo'o //
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo'o //
translated: deception and fraud.

original: des slong ba zlog par byed cing khas mi len to //
analyzed: des slong ba zlog par byed cing khas mi len to //
translated: One turns away the supplicant and does not give.

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin du mi byed pa ni des na khas blangs kyang sbyin par mi byed de /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin du mi byed pa ni des na khas blangs kyang sbyin par mi byed de /
translated: One does not give what one has promised, because one does not do what one says.

original: de gnyis kyi gnyen por sgyu dang g-yo yongs su spangs pa'i phyir dang / ji skad smras pa de ltar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi gnyen por sgyu dang g-yo yongs su spangs pa'i phyir dang / ji skad smras pa de ltar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The remedies for these two are stated: ‚Äúbecause of the complete abandonment of deceit and fraud, and because of doing what one says.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ma ni gcig ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ma ni gcig ste /
translated: There is one stain of the perfection of morality:

original: bden pa'i tshig rjes su mi bsrung ba'o //üîΩdes ni yang dag par blangs te dam bcas @137a * //
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig rjes su mi bsrung ba'o // des ni yang dag par blangs te dam bcas @137a * //
translated: not protecting the word of truth.

original: pa yang zhig par byed la /
analyzed: pa yang zhig par byed la /
translated: By that, one breaks one‚Äôs vow after having taken it.

original: zhig par byas pa yang 'chab par byed de /
analyzed: zhig par byas pa yang 'chab par byed de /
translated: And having broken it, one conceals it.

original: de'i gnyen po rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bden pa'i tshig lhur len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bden pa'i tshig lhur len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The remedy for that is stated: ‚Äúbecause of always taking the lead in the word of truth.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ma ni gcig ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ma ni gcig ste /
translated: There is one stain of the perfection of patience:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sun par byed pa'o //
translated: disrespect for the family of the Tathagatas.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sun par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sun par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does a bodhisattva offend against the family of the Tathagatas?

original: gzhan la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'i las kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'i las kyis so //
translated: By the action of harming others.

original: gzhan la snying brtse ba'i las can ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la snying brtse ba'i las can ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs yin no //
translated: The family of the Tathagatas is characterized by the action of compassion for others.

original: de bas gzhan la rnam par tho 'tshams pa ni de'i rigs can gyi las ngan pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas gzhan la rnam par tho 'tshams pa ni de'i rigs can gyi las ngan pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the action of harming others should be understood as the bad action of one who belongs to that family.

original: de'i gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sun par mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sun par mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: As the antidote to that, it is said, ‚Äúin order not to offend against the family of the Tathagatas.‚Äù

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ma ni gcig ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ma ni gcig ste /
translated: The one stain of the perfection of effort is

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa mang ba bya dka' ba dus ring po la spro ba nyams pa'o //
translated: the discouragement of the bodhisattva who is engaged in the many difficult practices for a long time.

original: de'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa mi gtong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa mi gtong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: As the antidote to that, it is said, ‚Äúin order not to abandon the training of the bodhisattvas.‚Äù

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ma ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ma ni gnyis te /
translated: The two stains of the perfection of meditation are

original: sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / de'i rgyus zil gyis gnon pa'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / de'i rgyus zil gyis gnon pa'o //
translated: mental distraction and, on account of that, being overwhelmed.

original: de'i gnyen por ri'i dbang po'i rgyal po de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems mi g-yos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por ri'i dbang po'i rgyal po de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems mi g-yos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is the passage beginning, ‚ÄúThe king of mountains does not move from its place.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ma ni gsum ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ma ni gsum ste /
translated: The stains of the perfection of wisdom are three:

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la shin tu mi phyogs shing mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la shin tu mi phyogs shing mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir /
translated: not turning away from and turning away from cyclic existence and nirvana, respectively;

original: thabs mi mkhas pa dag 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mi spogs pa dang / khyad par thob pas chog par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: thabs mi mkhas pa dag 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mi spogs pa dang / khyad par thob pas chog par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: and, due to lack of skill in means, not progressing on the supramundane path and being satisfied with the attainment of a lesser distinction.

original: de dag gi gnyen por 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad kyang mi 'dor la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs sogs pa la chog mi shes pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gong nas gong du khyad par du 'bogs pa yongs su tshol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te go rims bzhin no //

translated: The remedies for these are stated as follows: because one does not abandon any worldly activity, because one possesses the supramundane path, because one is not satisfied with the collection of the factors of enlightenment, and because one always seeks the special qualities without interruption.

original: de lta bu ni yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pas yang dag par brtson par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pas yang dag par brtson par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, one who is endowed with the perfection of dedication is one who strives properly.

original: 'di ni spyor bas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni spyor bas bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is taught through application.

original: sbyor ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Application is of four kinds:

original: dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs so //
analyzed: dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs so //
translated: faith, aspiration, effort, and means.

original: bcu @137b pa dang po las dad pa'i dbang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bcu @137b pa dang po las dad pa'i dbang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The first of these is called the power of faith.

original: dad pa'i dbang gis ni 'dun pa yang bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang gis ni 'dun pa yang bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the power of faith, aspiration is also included.

original: gnyis pa las nyin mtshan du dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs pas ngoms mi myong ba ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: gnyis pa las nyin mtshan du dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs pas ngoms mi myong ba ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: The second is the root of merit of the perfection of vigor, which is never satisfied with the roots of virtue accumulated day and night.

original: gsum pa las thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thabs yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa las thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thabs yin no //
translated: The third is the root of merit of the perfection of means, which is the desire for the stage of omniscience.

original: 'di ni sa bshad pa 'di la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sa bshad pa 'di la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called ‚Äúabiding in the explanation of the stages.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'og nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og nas /
translated: As it is said below:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag sa yongs su sbyong ba'i chos kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba rab tu gnas pa yin te zhes gsungs pa'o /üîΩ// / de ltar sa bshad nas sa 'di la gnas pa khyad par gang gis /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag sa yongs su sbyong ba'i chos kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba rab tu gnas pa yin te zhes gsungs pa'o / // / de ltar sa bshad nas sa 'di la gnas pa khyad par gang gis /
translated: ‚ÄúO sons of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva who possesses these aspects of the Dharma that purifies the stages is abiding in the bodhisattva stage of The Utterly Joyful One.‚Äù

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa de ston to //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa de ston to //
translated: Having explained the stages, the text now teaches the specific qualities by which one who abides in these stages is superior to the hearers and solitary realizers.

original: khyad par de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: khyad par de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: These specific qualities are threefold:

original: 'dun pa'i khyad par dang / sgrub pa'i khyad par dang / 'bras bu'i yon gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i khyad par dang / sgrub pa'i khyad par dang / 'bras bu'i yon gyi khyad par ro //
translated: the specific aspiration, the specific practice, and the specific result.

original: de la 'dun pa'i khyad par ni smon lam chen po bcu po rnams te /
analyzed: de la 'dun pa'i khyad par ni smon lam chen po bcu po rnams te /
translated: The specific aspiration is the ten great aspirations.

original: de dag gis bshad pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba de la gnas shing /üîΩsmon lam chen po rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di dag dang / brtson pa chen po dang / mngon par sgrub pa chen po dang / mngon par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis bshad pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba de la gnas shing / smon lam chen po rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di dag dang / brtson pa chen po dang / mngon par sgrub pa chen po dang / mngon par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the Joyful bodhisattva ground,üîΩthrough these great aspirations, great effort, great practice, and great accomplishment,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: makes the following great aspirations:

original: sangs rgyas ma lus pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro lhag ma med pa mtha' dag bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ma lus pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro lhag ma med pa mtha' dag bya ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to make offerings to all the buddhas without exception,üîΩwith the highest forms of worship,

original: rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan par mos pa rgya chen pos rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan par mos pa rgya chen pos rnam par dag pa /
translated: with vast, pure, and exalted intention,

original: chos kyi dbyings ltar rgya che ba /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ltar rgya che ba /
translated: as vast as the realm of phenomena,

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /

analyzed: mngon sum du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /üîΩchos kyi dbyings ltar rgya che ba /
translated: in order to understand and actualize the entire, vast, immeasurable, subtle, extensive, and

analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa / phyi @141a * //
translated: The realm of space is the limit of the realm of beings.

original: ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa /
analyzed: ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa /
translated: The end of the future is the limit of time.

original: bskal pa bgrangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bgrangs pa dang thams cad du 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa bgrangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bgrangs pa dang thams cad du 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
translated: The uninterrupted engagement in all enumerations of world systems and kalpas is the sixth.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ni mtshan nyid gsum du ye shes kyi khong du chud par bya zhing /üîΩmngon sum du 'gyur bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ni mtshan nyid gsum du ye shes kyi khong du chud par bya zhing / mngon sum du 'gyur bar bya ste /
translated: In this regard, all world systems should be understood and directly realized by gnosis as having three characteristics:

original: mtha' dag gi mtshan nyid dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dpag tu med pa'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩde la shin tu rgyas pa dang / tha gru che ba dang / tshod med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtha' dag gi mtshan nyid dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dpag tu med pa'i mtshan nyid do // de la shin tu rgyas pa dang / tha gru che ba dang / tshod med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the characteristic of totality, the characteristic of ultimate reality, and the characteristic of infinity.üîΩIn this regard, the three types of world systems are the extensive, the vast, and the measureless.

original: stong la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsum po dag go //üîΩphra ba ni gang dag na yid kyi lus rnams so //
analyzed: stong la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsum po dag go // phra ba ni gang dag na yid kyi lus rnams so //
translated: The three types of world systems are the thousandfold world system, the double-thousand world system, and the triple-thousand great thousandfold world system.üîΩThe subtle are those in which there are only mental bodies.

original: rags pa ni gang dag na yid kyi lus ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: rags pa ni gang dag na yid kyi lus ma yin pa rnams so //

original: chol pa ni go rims su mi gnas pa ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: chol pa ni go rims su mi gnas pa ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: The ‚Äúunbounded‚Äù are those who do not abide in order.

original: steng yogs med cing gzhi phyal pa ni khyim na gnas pa ma byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: steng yogs med cing gzhi phyal pa ni khyim na gnas pa ma byas pa rnams so //
translated: The ‚Äúunroofed‚Äù are those who have not built a house.

original: 'jug pa'i khyim can ni khyim na gnas pa byas pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i khyim can ni khyim na gnas pa byas pa rnams te /
translated: The ‚Äúhouse-entrants‚Äù are those who have built a house.

original: 'di na mtha' dag gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di na mtha' dag gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition of the totality.

original: rnam par dbye ba mig 'phrul lta bu ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba mig 'phrul lta bu ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The ‚Äúmagical‚Äù is the definition of the ultimate,

original: las sgyu ma las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las sgyu ma las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from the magic of action.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite‚Äù is the definition of the immeasurable,

original: phyogs bcu tshad med pa'i rnam par dbye ba ma lus pa la 'jug pa ni dpag tu med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs bcu tshad med pa'i rnam par dbye ba ma lus pa la 'jug pa ni dpag tu med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: because it enters into the infinite divisions of the ten directions.

original: de la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes kyis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes kyis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate definition is to be understood by means of intuition.

original: de las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid ni mngon sum nyid du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid ni mngon sum nyid du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The other definitions are to be realized in actuality.

original: smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub po //
analyzed: smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub po //
translated: He accomplishes the great vow.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: zhing thams cad zhing gcig dang / zhing gcig ltar zhing thams cad du mnyam par rgyu bas yongs su sbyong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa dang // 'od dang rnam par bkod pa'i rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal bas yongs su dag pa'i lam dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: zhing thams cad zhing gcig dang / zhing gcig ltar zhing thams cad du mnyam par rgyu bas yongs su sbyong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa dang // 'od dang rnam par bkod pa'i rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal bas yongs su dag pa'i lam dang ldan pa dang /
translated: They purify by means of the path of complete purity, which is free of all afflictions.üîΩThey purify by means of being filled with immeasurable sources of wisdom for sentient beings.üîΩThey purify by means of being directed toward the vast domain of the buddhas.

original: sems can ye shes kyi 'byung gnas tshad med pas rab tu gang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po la yang dag par gzhol ba dang / sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par bstan cing shin tu tshim par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can ye shes kyi 'byung gnas tshad med pas rab tu gang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po la yang dag par gzhol ba dang / sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par bstan cing shin tu tshim par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: They purify by means of teaching sentient beings in accordance with their thoughts and wishes and satisfying them.

original: chos kyi dbyings ltar rgya che ba /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ltar rgya che ba /
translated: They purify by means of being as vast as the realm of phenomena.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa /
translated: They purify by means of reaching the end of future time.

original: bskal pa bgrangs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing bgrangs pa thams cad du /
analyzed: bskal pa bgrangs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing bgrangs pa thams cad du /
translated: In all the eons and all the buddha-fields that are enumerated,

original: sangs @141b rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su sbyor ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: sangs @141b rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su sbyor ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
translated: the uninterrupted purification of all buddha-fields is the seventh.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa /
translated: The purification of the buddha-field

original: de yang rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /üîΩzhing thams cad zhing gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste / zhing thams cad zhing gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: should be understood as sevenfold:üîΩThe common purification of the field, because all fields are one field;

original: thun mong ba yongs su dag pa dang / zhing gcig ltar zhing thams cad du mnyam par rgyu bas yongs su sbyong ba nyid kyi phyir dbang po yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa dag 'od dang / rnam par bkod pa'i rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan pa nyid kyi phyir 'od kyi rgyan dang /
analyzed: thun mong ba yongs su dag pa dang / zhing gcig ltar zhing thams cad du mnyam par rgyu bas yongs su sbyong ba nyid kyi phyir dbang po yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa dag 'od dang / rnam par bkod pa'i rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan pa nyid kyi phyir 'od kyi rgyan dang /
translated: the purification of the faculties, because the bodhisattva moves equally in all fields as in one field; the adornment of light, because immeasurable buddha-fields are adorned with the array of light and forms;

original: gnas pa'i rgyan gyis mdzes pa yongs su dag pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal bas yongs su dag pa'i lam dang ldan pa'i phyir yongs su spyad pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems can ye shes kyi 'byung gnas tshad med pas rab tu gang ba'i phyir gnas pa po'i sems can yongs su dag pa dang /üîΩsangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po la 'jug pa mngon par sgrub pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes dang mthu gnyis kyis sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par ston cing /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyan gyis mdzes pa yongs su dag pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal bas yongs su dag pa'i lam dang ldan pa'i phyir yongs su spyad pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems can ye shes kyi 'byung gnas tshad med pas rab tu gang ba'i phyir gnas pa po'i sems can yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po la 'jug pa mngon par sgrub pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes dang mthu gnyis kyis sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par ston cing /
translated: It is completely pure in terms of the beings who dwell there, because it is filled with immeasurable beings who are the source of wisdom.üîΩIt is completely pure in terms of the cause, because it is the accomplishment of engaging in the vast domain of the buddhas.

original: tshim par bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: tshim par bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: It is completely pure in terms of the result, because it is the teaching of the Dharma in accordance with the wishes of beings through wisdom and power and the satisfaction of beings.

original: smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub po //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub po //üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, he accomplishes the great aspirations.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / bsam pa dang sbyor ba gcig par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'gran zla med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags par bya ba'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang dmigs pa gcig pas mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / bsam pa dang sbyor ba gcig par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'gran zla med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags par bya ba'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang dmigs pa gcig pas mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to be of one mind and deed with all bodhisattvas, in order to accumulate roots of virtue that are without rival, in order to be equal to all bodhisattvas by means of a single focus,

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par byang chub sems dpa' dang 'grogs shing mi 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba ci dgar bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / rang gi sems bskyed pas de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu 'byed pa ye shes kyis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par byang chub sems dpa' dang 'grogs shing mi 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba ci dgar bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / rang gi sems bskyed pas de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu 'byed pa ye shes kyis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: in order to always be in the company of bodhisattvas without interruption, in order to manifest the appearance of a buddha as one wishes, in order to understand through wisdom the differentiation of the tathagatas by means of one's own generation of the mind,

original: ma nyams shing rjes su 'gro ba'i mngon par shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam par rgyu bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du snang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: ma nyams shing rjes su 'gro ba'i mngon par shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam par rgyu bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du snang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to attain preternatural knowledge that is not lost and is effective, in order to move about in all world systems, in order to attain the light of all circles of assembly,üîΩin order to follow one‚Äôs own body in all births, in order to be endowed with the inconceivable Great Vehicle, and in order to practice the bodhisattva way of life,

original: skye ba thams cad du rang gi lus rjes su 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir dang / theg pa chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩchos kyi @142a * //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad du rang gi lus rjes su 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir dang / theg pa chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par bya ba'i phyir / chos kyi @142a * //
translated: the bodhisattvas‚ÄôüîΩgreat armor

original: dbyings ltar rgya che ba /
analyzed: dbyings ltar rgya che ba /
translated: is like the vastness of the realm of phenomena,

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
translated: extends to the limits of the realm of space,

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa /
translated: and reaches the end of future time.

original: bskal pa bgrangs pa dang / spyod pa bgrangs pa thams cad theg pa chen po la 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa bgrangs pa dang / spyod pa bgrangs pa thams cad theg pa chen po la 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth great vow, which is to be uninterrupted in entering the Great Vehicle for all the eons and practices to come.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang ; bsam pa dang / sbyor ba gcig pa nyid kyi phyir theg pa gzhan mi 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang ; bsam pa dang / sbyor ba gcig pa nyid kyi phyir theg pa gzhan mi 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the same in thought and application as all bodhisattvas and because they do not aspire to other vehicles.üîΩ

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam pa bcus rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam pa bcus rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: It is distinguished by ten aspects of the bodhisattvas' activities.

original: rnam pa bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten aspects?

original: 'gran zla med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / dmigs pa gcig pa nyid dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par byang chub sems dpa' dang 'grogs shing mi 'bral ba nyid dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba ci dgar ston pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'gran zla med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / dmigs pa gcig pa nyid dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par byang chub sems dpa' dang 'grogs shing mi 'bral ba nyid dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba ci dgar ston pa nyid dang /
translated: They are the accumulation of roots of virtue that are without equal, the single focus of all bodhisattvas, the constant and uninterrupted association with and inseparability from the bodhisattvas, the manifestation of the appearance of buddhas whenever one wishes,

original: rang gi sems bskyed pas de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu 'byed pa ye shes kyis khong du chud pa nyid dang / ma nyams shing rjes su 'gro ba'i mngon par shes pa thob pa nyid dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam par rgyu ba nyid dang /
analyzed: rang gi sems bskyed pas de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu 'byed pa ye shes kyis khong du chud pa nyid dang / ma nyams shing rjes su 'gro ba'i mngon par shes pa thob pa nyid dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam par rgyu ba nyid dang /
translated: The bodhisattvas' generation of the mind of enlightenment is distinguished by ten qualities: it is the cause of the vision of the buddhas; it is the cause of the attainment of the wisdom that distinguishes all the dharmas; it is the cause of the attainment of the superknowledges that are not lost and that are applied as desired; it is the cause of the attainment of the ability to go to all the world systems;

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du snang ba thob pa nyid dang / skye ba thams cad du rang gi lus rjes su 'gro ba nyid dang / theg pa chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa nyid do //üîΩde la dang po ni tshogs kyis rab tu phye ba'o //üîΩgnyis pa ni mthun par dmigs pas nang du yang dag 'jog pas so //üîΩgsum pa ni 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pas so //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du snang ba thob pa nyid dang / skye ba thams cad du rang gi lus rjes su 'gro ba nyid dang / theg pa chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa nyid do // de la dang po ni tshogs kyis rab tu phye ba'o // gnyis pa ni mthun par dmigs pas nang du yang dag 'jog pas so // gsum pa ni 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pas so //
translated: it is the cause of the attainment of the ability to manifest in all the assemblies; it is the cause of the attainment of the ability to manifest one's body in all the rebirths; it is the cause of the attainment of the ability to manifest the inconceivable MahƒÅyƒÅna;

original: bzhi pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba ci dgar ston pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba ci dgar ston pa'o //
translated: it is the cause of the attainment of the ability to manifest the enjoyment of the Dharma; and it is the cause of the attainment of the ability to manifest the performance of the duties of a buddha.

original: lnga pa ni rang gi sems bskyed pa'i khyad par gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku rjes su dran pas so //
analyzed: lnga pa ni rang gi sems bskyed pa'i khyad par gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku rjes su dran pas so //
translated: The fifth is the recollection of the Dharma Body of the Tathagata by the special development of his own mind.

original: drug pa ni mngon par shes pa shin tu thob pas so //
analyzed: drug pa ni mngon par shes pa shin tu thob pas so //
translated: The sixth is the attainment of the superknowledges.

original: lhag ma rnams ni mngon par shes pa'i las kyis rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni mngon par shes pa'i las kyis rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: The rest are distinguished by the activity of the superknowledges.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu 'gro ba dang / bdag dang / gzhan dag dang / de dag phan tshun yang dag par ston pa dang / skal ba 'dra bar 'gro ba dang / theg pa chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'dzud pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu 'gro ba dang / bdag dang / gzhan dag dang / de dag phan tshun yang dag par ston pa dang / skal ba 'dra bar 'gro ba dang / theg pa chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'dzud pa ste /
translated: He goes to other world systems, and he and others are mutually revealed there. He goes to the same destiny, and he introduces to the inconceivable Great Vehicle.

original: smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: He accomplishes the great vows.
